loans.name: Suku

texts.en:
Suku C. currently sells tomatoes at her local market and is requesting a loan to purchase additional items to sell including rice, beans, and sweet potatoes.  Suku is 31 years old and her husband is a soldier. She has one child who does not go to school.  With the additional income from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a retail shop.


About BRAC
 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 58 years and has a rice farming business. She started her business in 2005. This is the only way she can provide for the needs of her family. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in June 2008 to obtain a loan for additional capital for her business. Now she's asking 15,000 PHP to continue managing her business. This loan will of great help to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Soukaly Kom-Kom Group

texts.en:
The development of petty commerce and, particularly, retail commerce experienced great growth in the currency devaluation of the 1980s in Senegal. This structural crisis was marked by a significant reduction in purchasing power for Senegalese people and especially those from the least privileged social classes. Entire families failed to meet their food and healthcare needs. It was this desire to find a way to increase their purchasing power that has encouraged these women to start producing and selling cakes that are very much in demand by the local population.

Putting in place these ovens gives women better access to baking facilities with reduced production costs and will allow them to maximize their profits in this business. The oven will be open to all women who bake cakes and production will take place in town. The women hope to take orders to make cakes for ceremonies and other special occasions. 

This text was translated from the original French, below:

Le développement du petit commerce surtout du commerce de détail a connu une effervescence à partir de la dévaluation monétaire des années 1980 survenu au Sénégal. Cette crise structurelle est marquée par une forte baisse du pouvoir d’achat des sénégalais et surtout des couches sociales les plus défavorisées. Des familles entières n’arrivaient pas à satisfaire leur besoin alimentaire mais aussi sanitaire. C’est dans le souci d’une recherche quotidienne de l’accroissement de leur pouvoir d’achat que ces femmes s’adonnent à la production et à la commercialisation de gâteaux très sollicités par les populations. 

La mise en place de ces four participera à la facilitation d’accès des femmes au four à la réduction des charges de production pour maximiser leurs bénéfices dans la mise en ouvre de ce commerce.
Le four sera ouvert à toutes les femmes productrices de gâteaux et la production sera écoulée dans la ville. Les commandes de gâteaux pour les cérémonies et autres fêtes seront exploitées par ces femmes.

loans.use: To purchase an oven to bake cakes.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Сафаров Муродали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Сафаров Муродали в области животноводства работает более 6 лет. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Сафаров Муродали хочет увеличить количество скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Murodali S. lives in the Yavan region. He is 30 years old; married with 5 children. Murodali has worked in cattle breeding for over 6 years. He fattens up and sells cattle. Murodali would like to increase the size of his livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en:
Shirlita F. is from the village of Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years-old and married with one school-aged child.  Shirlita owns and operates a general store which sells a variety of different products in the local community. Shirlita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Shirlita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Shirlita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Shirlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital.

loans.name: Kyoterekera Omunaku Farida Kayegi Group

texts.en: Farida K. is the Group Representative for 'Kyoterekera Omunaku Group'. She is a hard-working business lady of twenty-eight years old. She is married, with three children, of whom two are going to school, and she has two dependents who are also schooling. She has a restaurant business and she has been in her business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase foodstuffs for her restaurant. She is encouraging and hard-working and her future hope is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Divina Luz 3 Group

texts.en:
Olfa is the coordinator of her group, Divina Luz (Divine Light). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many Dominican clients have recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos: a dusty, industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Olfa is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and to have the opportunity to access capital at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon by purchasing more hair products as well as adding a small clothes business to complement her salon. She will use the profits to invest in an inverter for her home to help mitigate the effect of frequent blackouts and to save towards the future of her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair products and clothes to sell

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, G. Véronique est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Véronique est une veuve qui s’est installée à Cocotomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, depuis six ans environs. Véronique vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Véronique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Véronique prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, igname pilé, accompagnés de différentes sauce) dans sa boutique à Cocotomey. Véronique s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Véronique exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans, et a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Véronique sollicite un deuxième prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Véronique G. is mother to two children who are both at school. She is a widow who settled around six years ago in Cocotomey in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. Véronique lives alone with her children and takes responsibility for their various expenses. She did not go to school. In order to provide for her needs, she sells food (corn dough and crushed yam, accompanied by various sauces) in her shop in Cocotomey. Véronique gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has been carrying out this activity for five years and has already had one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid in full. Faced with growing customer demand, Véronique is applying for a second loan in order to reinforce her business and satisfy her customers more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of five bags of corn, two bags of yam, three cartons of fish and meat, condiments.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace F. is from the village of Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 21 years old. Mary Grace is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Mary Grace is starting a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She will be selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Grace is just starting this business.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 42 years old and married with three children who are 8, 11 and 14 years old. Emmanuel is a self-employed businessman who is well known for selling spare parts. He has been in this business for about two years. His business hours are from 7 am to 5 pm every day.

Emmanuel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of spare parts (mainly Mercedes Benz parts, as they bring a higher rate of income). With this business, Emmanuel expects to earn more profit, which in turn will allow him to continue paying school fees for his children and reinvesting in his business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of spare parts

loans.name: Oxiacaque Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Oxiacaque”  nombrado así por que son originarias del  Poblado del mismo nombre. Esta integrado por seis mujeres. Los representa doña Patricia U. C., tiene 1 hijo, su esposo es electricista, con el crédito comprara cables, focos, contactos, probador D. luz, pinzas, cintas.  Todos los hijos D. Doña Aniceta están casados, su actividad es L. venta D. comida que lleva a ofrecer a los empleados D. compañías que se ubican en ese poblado, L. señorita Edita  tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio, doña  Isidra  tienen 2 hijos, se dedica  a L. venta D. pescado en su domicilio, doña Margarita y María Jesús  se dedican a L. cría D. cerdos para su posterior matanza y venta D. carne, doña Margarita tiene 3 hijos y María Jesús ninguno.  


Doña Chucha como así L. conocen en su comunidad, comprará cerdo, alimento, vitaminas, su esposo es quien se encarga D. matar  y salir a ofrecer L. carne por su comunidad que también venD. chicharrones, longaniza, manteca. Su meta es que sus hijos tengan mejor nivel D. vida y poner un local D. carnicería en su comunidad y comunidades vecinas. 

Todas son muy alegres y están  contentas D. que se les pueda dar un apoyo para hacer crecer  sus actividades económicas, 4 tienen actividades diferentes y 2 son parecidas, es un grupo solidario.

Están muy agradecidas por el apoyo que le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA al tomarlas en cuenta para otorgarles un financiamiento y hacer que sus negocios tengan éxito
texts.en:
The“Oxiacaque” group is called that because they are from the town of the same name. It is maD. up of six women. They are represented by Patricia U. C.. She has 1 child and her husband is an electrician. She will buy cables, lightbulbs, contacts, electricity tester, pliers and tape. All of Aniceta's children are married. Her activity is selling food that she offers the employees of companies in town. Edita has a little grocery store in her home. Isidra has 2 children, and she sells fish from her home. Margarita and Maria Jesus raise pigs for slaughter and sell meat. Margarita has 3 children and Maria Jesus has none. Chucha, as she is known in her community, will buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. Her husband is the one who is in charge of slaughtering and selling the meat in the community. He also sells pork rinds, longaniza, and lard. Her goal is for her children to have a better quality of life and to have a butcher shop in her community and in neighboring communities. All of them are very cheerful and they are happy that they are able to have the support to grow their economic activities. 4 of the activities are different and 2 are similar. It is a supportive group. They are very grateful for the support offered by the foundation and KIVA for considering them when granting them financing and making their businesses successful.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs, fish, knives, feed, vitamins, chicken, meat, tomatoes, onions, peppers, disposable cups and plates, cables, lightbulbs, contacts, electricity tester, pliers, electrical tape.

loans.name: Mary Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Mary Cristina forma parte del  banco comunal Mujeres del Futuro en la ciudad de Portoviejo, el grupo que se reúnen en la ciudadela Las Orquídea a las afuera de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio informal de ropa, compra al por mayor en la ciudad de Portoviejo en los grandes mayoristas prendas como pantalones, blusas y prendas íntimas  negocio que lo mantiene por más de dos años.

Nuestra socia tiene una hija, durante el día se dedica a la venta de la mercadería y por las noches junto al esposo tiene otra actividad, trabajan para una empresa de purificadores de aire para el hogar, visitan a los clientes en sus casas para hacer la demostración del producto, este negocio lo tiene recientemente les va bien, pero en realidad la señora Mary Cristina esta mas dedicada a la venta de ropa.

 Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en surtir el negocio, tiene por entregar varios pedidos como perfumes y maquillaje, una vez que entrega la mercadería el cliente le cancela el 50 % y el saldo a una semana.
texts.en:
Mary Cristina is part of the community bank Mujeres del Futuro ("Women of the Future") in the city of Portoviejo, which meets in the Las Orquidea community on the outskirts of the city. She sells clothing informally, buying it wholesale in the city of Portoviejo. She buys items from the major wholesalers such as pants, shirts and underwear and has been doing this for more than two years. Mary Christina has one daughter. During the day she sells merchandise and at night she and her husband work for a home air purifier company. They visit customers in their homes to give product demonstrations. They started this business recently and it is going well, but in reality Mary Christina is more dedicated to clothing sales. With this loan she will be able to invest in her business. She has various orders to fill, for items such as perfumes and makeup. After delivering the merchandise to the customer, the customer will pay 50%, and the balance in one week.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda J. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 36 years old. Belinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beverages in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Belinda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Fantasy Group

texts.es:
Ellos son el grupo Fantasy, llamado así por propuesta de uno de los integrantes ya que querían un nombre alegre, único y que los diferenciara, integrado por cinco personas con valentía,  coraje y muchas ganas de trabajar, además de un gran espíritu de visión y determinación y que trabajan diariamente para salir adelante y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus familias. Ellos radican en la comunidad de Ixtapaluca en el Estado de México. Los integrantes del grupo son: Araceli M. F. (Venta de Botanas y perfumes), Laura H. G. (Taller de Costura), Rosalba F. F. (Venta de ropa en general), Verónica M. C. (Venta de Cosméticos por catalogo) y Alejandro Juárez López (Venta de Bisutería)

Araceli F. es representante del grupo, tiene 35 años, con dos hijos que estudian primaria y secundaria, desde hace 13 años se dedica a las ventas ya que es una persona a la cual le gusta tener su propio dinero para así poder brindarle una ayuda a su papá y ayudar con los gastos de su casa, actualmente vende botanas como cacahuates, pistaches, gomitas, dulces, etc., y acaba de iniciar con la venta de perfumes, Araceli sale cada tercer día a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa en su comunidad, sus días de mayor venta son los fines de semana. Araceli desea que sus hijos puedan terminar de estudiar y lleguen a tener una carrera ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo, al igual que desea poder ampliar su casa y tener un mejor espacio para su familia El crédito que solicita lo va a destinar a la inversión de su mercancía como perfumes en general y botanas, para poder tener más clientes.

Cada integrante tiene planes y expectativas diferentes pero todos tienen deseos de hacerlos realidad y agradecen a Kiva el apoyo que se les brinda a través de Fundación Realidad.
texts.en:
Introducing the Fantasy Group, whose name was suggested by one for its members looking for a unique and happy name that would distinguish them. The group is formed by five resolute, brave and hard-working people with great spirits, vision and determination, working daily to progress and to offer a better future to their families. They live in the community of Ixtapaluca, Mexico. These are the members of the group: Araceli M. F. (snacks and perfumes sale), Laura H. G. (sewing workshop), Rosalba F. F. (clothes sale), Verónica M. C. (cosmetics sale by order) and Alejandro Juárez López (costume jewelry sale). Araceli F. represents the group: she is 35 years old, she has two children attending primary and secondary school and has been engaged in trading for 13 years, as she is likes being able to count on her own earnings so that she can help her father and help covering for the expenses of her house. She currently sells snacks such as peanuts, pistachios, wine gums, sweets and so on, and she has just started selling perfumes. Every three days, Araceli goes around her community selling her products door to door, and the week-end is when she makes the most out of her sales. Areceli wishes for her children to finish school and have a career, because she did not have the chance to do it; at the same time she wishes to extend her house and gain more space for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy perfumes and snacks in order to gain more customers. Every member has different plans and expectations, but they all wish to make their dreams come true, and they are thankful to Kiva for the support it offers them through Fundación Realidad.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks, perfumes and other different core products to sell.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Ayidn A. jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Emu 52 qoda. Aydin pereselenec iz okupirovannoy territorii Azerbaydjana, oblasti Kalbadjar i seychas obosnovalsya v Khirdalane. 

Eto vtoroye obrasheniye Aydina. On ochen blaqodaren za pervuyu ssudu v kotorom on prosil 1000 $ chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye eqo maqazina.
No teper Aydin otkril kafe uje 2 qoda. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svoyeqo kafe.
texts.en:
Aydin A. is married with two children. He is 52 years old. Aydin is a refugee from an occupied territory in Azerbaijan, region of Kalbadjar, and now lives in Khirdalan. This is Aydin’s second loan. He is very grateful for the first loan in which he requested $1000 in order to expand his store. Aydin opened a café two years ago. Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs for his café.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tables and chairs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Y. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason and Mary supports him in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has been through senior high school.

Mary sells smoked fish at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy extra fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in the sale of plastic bowls.

loans.use: To buy extra fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina N. is a senior high school graduate. She is a hairdresser at Takoradi. She is married and has a child. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams to treat her customers’ hair. She hopes to reinvest back into her business should there be any increase in profit.

loans.use: buy more hair creams to treat her customers’ hair

loans.name: Seleto Ene

texts.en:
Seleton Ene S. is 25 years old, and she supports two members of her family. She explains that she is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

To earn a living, Seleton is a farmer. Specifically, she farms on her own piece of land, and she has been doing so for the last four years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women who are already registered members of KADET LTD in her area of residence. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 25,000 KES ($325), which would be her first loan from KADET LTD. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy pestsides to spray her crops (mostly wheat) to prevent them from being invaded by pests. She hopes to use the profits generated from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small-scale to commercial-level farming. In fact, Seleton's dream is run a large-scale farming operation and to attain financial independence.

loans.use: to spend twenty five thousands buy pestsides

loans.name: Kuña Renda Group

texts.es:
Este Comité denominado Kuña Renda, del Bº Conavi DE Walter Insfrán DE Caaguazú, actualmente se encuentran en el 5to ciclo, son 25 señoras que se unieron para formar un grupo solidario con la intención DE obtener un pequeño capital para invertir en sus trabajos diarios.
Ellas son muy unidas, responsables, trabajadoras y solidA.. Las mismas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que encuentran con crédito ya facilita el trabaja de las mismas.
Liza es una de las integrantes, una mujer muy activa dentro del grupo y que realiza vA. actividades con sus socias para recaudar fondos para pagar las cuotas de los prestamos.
Ella se dedica en forma independiente a la venta de ropas, esta actividad lo realiza en un salon que posee en su domicilio y para la atencion la ayuda toda su famili de acuerso a al tiempo disponible que tiene cada una.
Solicta el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalenes, vestidos, todo de la temporada de primavera.
texts.en:
This committee is named Kuña Renda and they come from the area of Conavi, Walter Insfrán in Caaguazú. They are currently in their fifth loan cycle. The committee is made up of 25 women who united to form a close group with the intention of obtaining a small working capital to invest in their daily work.
The women are very responsible, hard working, supportive and united. They are very grateful for the opportunities they have received with this loan as it has lightened their workload.

Liza, one of the group's members, is a very active woman in the group and carries out various activities with other members to raise funds to repay the loan installments. She works independently selling clothes in a salon that she has set up in her home. Her family help her to serve customers whenever they have time available. Liza is requesting a loan to purchase t-shirts, jumpers, pants, shirts and dresses for the Spring season.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, jumpers, pants, shirts and dresses

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is married with four children.  This hardworking and focused lady used to practice horticultural farming, but for the past five years has been a dairy farmer.  She supplements her income by rearing poultry.  She has employed one person in her business.  

Serah has requested 85,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the training they provided her in proper business record-keeping practices, which has enabled her to run her business well.  She sees herself adding more cows and chicks to her farm in the next five years.  She also hopes to provide her children with the highest level of education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Darwin Gustavo

texts.es:
Darwin de 25 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber-cabinas,  vive con su esposa e hijo de un año en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas).

Comenzó hace 8 años atrás como vendedor de celulares y también aprendió arreglar computadoras, poco a poco y con su experiencia hace dos años atrás, puso su negocio Cyber-cabinas. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los dias. Trabaja en conjunto con su esposa dando los servicios de llamadas, cyber y venta de helados. 

Con el prestamo quiere aumenta su negocio por eso quiere comprar drive de programas para arreglar las computadoras que actualmente tiene. En el futuro quiere trasladar el cybe cerca de una escuela o colegio para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Darwin is 25 years old and has a small internet and phone café. He lives with his wife and 1-year-old son in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a periurban area with unpaved roads and houses in the mountains).

He began 8 years ago selling cell phones and he also learned to fix computers. With his experience, two years ago he set up his internet and phone business little by little. He works from 8am to 10pm every day, and works with his wife providing call service, internet, and selling ice cream.

With the loan, he wants to expand his business and wants to buy a programming drive to fix the computers that he currently has. In the future, he wants to move the internet café close to an elementary school or high school to have better earnings.

loans.use: Programming drive

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia  es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con tres hijos, tiene grado de instrucción de primaria completa.
Virginia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital de su negocio de engorde de ganado vacuno.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital  de su negocio.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the September 22nd Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Virginia has an elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN and was used to increase her business capital for fattening cattle.

Virginia is now requesting a new loan of 2000 PEN, which will increase the capital of her business. Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is sharing the joy.

loans.use: Operating capital for fattening cattle

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 18 años, vive en unión familiar con su mamá y sus 6 hermanos en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. A los que quiere y aprecia mucho.Está joven señorita, hábil y con mucho futuro, estudia en el instituto de bellas artes de su localidad, donde está aprendiendo a pintar hermosos cuadros, pues el arte lo lleva en las venas, ya que su familia se dedica a la artesanía, su principal actividad es el bordado de disfraces, faldas y manteles. Ya tienen un año emprendiendo su propio negocio y según afirma le esta yendo muy bien y cada día tienen más pedidos. Ahora ella quiere trabajar muy duro, para expandir su negocio, y juntar el dinero necesario para poder estudiar la carrera de gastronomía. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está segura que gracias a su banco comunal, logrará concretizar sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le servirá para la compra de telas, hilos y blondas. Insumos necesarios para elaborar las 35 faldas que le mandaron a realizar.
texts.en: Rocío is 18 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro de Cajas with her mother and 6 siblings, whom she loves and appreciates very much. This young girl, skilled with a good future ahead, studies at the Institute of Fine Arts in the area, where she is learning to paint beautiful pictures. Art is in her blood, as her family is dedicated to the craft. Her main activity is the embroidery of costumes, skirts and tablecloths. For the past year, she has already begun her own business and asserts it is going very well and every day has more orders. Now she wants to work very hard to expand her business and raise the money necessary to pursue a career in foods. This is her first loan with MFP and she is sure, thanks to her community bank, she will achieve her goals. With the loan she will purchase fabrics, yarn, and lace, the necessary inputs to produce the 35 skirts she was asked to make.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, yarn and lace for the development of skirts.

loans.name: Ana Coralia

texts.es:
Doña Ana, reside en Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután, tiene 55 años de edad, posee una tienda el negocio lo administra desde hace 6 años, lo atiende desde 6:30am a 8:00pm, ella vive con sus hijas pues es madre soltera,  y ellas le ayudan a atender a los clientes, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia ya que debía recibir ingresos para mantener a sus hijas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de azúcar, aceite, frijol, jugos en lata, jabón, papel higiénico, este préstamo le ayudara a comprar estos productos que darán fortaleza al negocio, podrá atender mejor a los clientes ya que les ofrecerá diversidad de productos necesarios en cada hogar.
Su proyecto es invertir en el negocio, darle estabilidad para recibir mejores ingresos para cubrir más cómodamente los gastos del hogar y ayudar a que sus hijos asistan a la universidad
texts.en:
Ana lives in Santiago de María, in the department of Usulután. She is 55 years old and she owns a shop. She has been running her shop for 6 years, working there from 6:30 am to 8 pm. A single mother, she lives with her daughters who help her tending to customers. She independently decided to start her activity as she needed to earn money to provide for her daughters.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar, oil, beans, cans of juice, soap, toilet paper: buying these products thanks to this loan will give strength to her activity, as she will be able to tend to more customers by offering a variety of products that every house needs.
Her plan is to invest in her activity: by providing stability to her shop she will earn more money in order to more comfortably pay for her household expenses and to make it possible for her daughters to attend university.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, beans, cans of juice, soap and toilet paper to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a photographer and inherited a studio from his father. Ahmed is a father of one daughter and one son. He is a professional photographer who had taken advanced courses in editing. His unique skills attract a good number of clients.

Ahmed wants to buy a new professional camera with the help of a loan he took from FATEN. Ahmed is known for the great quality of his work, time and respect.

Ahmed is pictured here standing in his studio.

loans.use: To purchase a professional camera

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 44 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and twelve years old. He sells meat. He employs two people in the business and he has been in the business for four years. The hours of the business are from 7.30am until 3pm every day.

Pascal will use this loan to purchase more meat. He will reinvest any profits he makes back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco sells paint in a variety of colors. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. His children are two and three years old. Currently, his children do not attend school.

Jean Bosco has been selling color paints for four years. He has requested this loan to buy more color paints to increase the quality of his work. With the profits from his expanded business, he would like to save funds and renovate his house.

In the future, he hopes to have a loan of one and a half million RWF.

loans.use: To buy more tins of color paints to sell.

loans.name: Senado

texts.en:
Senado G. is from the village of Panay Diot Tudela.  He is 49 years old.  Senado is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Senado owns and operates a transportation services business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services.  Senado has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Senado joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Senado is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Senado from GDMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle to improve service.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman who lives in Quezon, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Rosaldo works as a truck driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 7 and 22 years old. Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rowena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 17,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st  loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Rowena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.en:
Bakhtiniso F. owns a facility in the central city market selling fabrics for sewing national women dresses. She has been in this trade for 15 years. 

Her turnover capital has doubled since she started her small business. She is married with four children. She lives in Penjikent, Tajikistan. 

Bakhtiniso has a perfect credit history in IMON International. She has repaid all her loans without any delinquencies. Bakhtiniso believes a loan of 10,000 TJS will help her increase her working capital and profits. She wants to purchase more variety of fabrics and expand her marketing area. 

Bakhtiniso has become an entrepreneur through hard work and dedication and she believes this will help her succeed in the future. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fabrics and expand her marketing area

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita C. is 67 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She is from the village of Danao within Plaridel municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Warlita runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over eleven years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month.

In 1999, Warlita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Warlita is requesting a new loan, her nineteenth loan from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase retail products for her general store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase retail products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a married woman with eight children. Five of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cresencia is 52 years old.

Cresencia has a vegetables and spice vending business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Cresencia has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif N. lives in the village of Mushevani, Bolnisi District. He is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife, Lachin, and two sons (24 and 22 years old). Vagif runs a grocery store in his village. He buys groceries in Marneuli (a nearby town) and sells them in his store. Along with the grocery store the N.’s family is engaged in agricultural activities: They grow potatoes, haricot beans, and maize. The grains and vegetables are sold locally. 

Vagif requested a loan to increase his stock-in-trade in the store. This will increase the income of the family and will help them to purchase some furniture for their house.

loans.use: to purchase stock-in-trade for his grocery store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a home-products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy additional stock of home products to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for two years. Luisa earns more income from raising pigs.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of home products to sell.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Amina Jamari runs a food vending service. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She works from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. Amina is in her early thirties. She and her husband have four children who are still enrolled in school. 

This will be Amina's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes to obtain a new loan in order to continue to increase her stock of food items required for her business. Her dream is to better support her children and to see them enrolled in good schools.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, "Mwaminifu." The group has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to continue to increase her stock of the food items required for her business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two grown sons. She runs a clothing store in her home town of Melitopol. She rents a facility to sell men’s and women’s clothing inventory, in particular jean clothing items. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Odessa. Olga is an experienced entrepreneur who has been in the market for 15 years. Presently, she makes about 8,500 Grivnyas of net profit per month.
Olga is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase lighter summer jean clothing to meet her female customers' seasonal demand. One of her short-term business plans is to open an additional vending location in Melitopol in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal jeans wholesale.

loans.name: La Grâce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA GRÂCE DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Josephine Ablawa, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Josephine Ablawa est née le 20 Mars 1973 au Bénin et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Gaspard. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Josephine Ablawa et sa famille habitent ensemble. Josephine Ablawa a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au cours secondaire. Il y a environs six ans que Josephine Ablawa mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, farine de manioc, etc.) dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Josephine Ablawa s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. La clientèle de Josephine Ablawa devient de plus en plus grande, et Josephine Ablawa voudrait renforcer davantage son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Josephine Ablawa et les autres membres du groupe LA GRÂCE DE DIEU se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un premier crédit.
texts.en: The group La Grâce de Dieu [Grace of God] is made up of three people, all living in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group’s representative, Josephine Ablawa, is raising her hand in the photo.  This is the first time the group has requested financial support from Alidé in order to build their business.  Josephine Ablawa was born on March 20th, 1973, in Benin, and is married to a driver named Gaspard.  The couple has five children, all in school, three of which are still in their care.  Josephine Ablawa lives together with her family.  She attended school, but stopped at the secondary level.  For about six years, she has been working selling various products (canned goods, soaps, cassava root flour, etc.) in her neighborhood.  This business enables her to provide for her children without too much difficulty.  She buys her supplies in one of Benin’s markets.  Her customer base is expanding, and she wants to grow her business in order to better meet the demand.  To do so, and because she doesn’t have the financial resources to make her dream a reality, Josephine Ablawa has come to Alidé - along with the other members of the group La Grâce de Dieu - to request their first loan.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 39 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elvira has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.  Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gisele Annie Florence

texts.fr:
Cliente de 47 ans , mariee et mere de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 25 ans. Ayant arrete ses etudes en classe de terminal il ya de cela 18 ans, vu sa charge elle ouvre un atelier de couture pour faire des series de draps.Elle confectionne des camisoles des draps a domicile et elle a une forte clientele, ses revenus  sont de 10.000 a 35.000 frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret ,elle compte renforcer le stock des pagnes des tissus, des rouleaux de popeline de differents couleurs,rouleaux de coton satine fleuris, de la dentelle,des pagnes de differents motifs  des lots  fils a coudre, de la vegeline, des fils a coudre.

Tres ambitieuse, elle a des commandes des camisoles et des  draps qu'elle coud , et ses meilleures clientes sont des femmes  et elle fait  aussi des livraisons des  tenues des femmes et camisoles  dans des boutiques de la place .
texts.en:
Gisèle, age 47, is married and the mother of 5 children, age 10 to 25. Having interrupted her studies at 12th grade level 18 years ago, she opened a sewing workshop to makes series of sheets. She makes camisoles and sheets at her home, and has a strong customer base. Her daily revenues range from XOF 10'000 to 35'000 (ca US$ 20 to 70).

With her new loan, she intends to bolster her stock of pagnes (colorful African cloth), fabrics, poplins in various colors, flowery satin cotton rolls, lace, pagnes with various motifs, and bundles of sewing thread.

Very ambitious, she gets orders for camisoles and sheets that she sews. Her best customers are women, and she also delivers women's outfits and camisoles to the boutiques in town.

loans.use: to buy cotton fabric, satin cotton rolls, lace, thread, etc

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: LA SRA NANCY DE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD SOLTERA  CON 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD,ES SOCIA  DEL GRUPO PAZ Y BIEN .LA SRA NANCY EN LA ACTUALIDAD SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MENESTRAS Y A LA VENTA DE VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO DE EL TAMBO,DESDE HORAS TEMPRANAS DE LA  MAÑANA ,TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS  DE LUNES A DOMINGO. LA SRA NANCY SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER INCREMENTAR  MAS MERCADERIA EN SU NEGOCIO. LA SRA NANCY QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO TENER UN PUESTO MAS GRANDE EN EL MERCADO EL TAMBO  Y ASI PODER OBTENER MAS UTILIDADES. LA SRA NANCY SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA DETRAS DE LA SRA QUE VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR ANARANJADO. LA SRA NANCY VISTE  UNA CASACA Y CHOMPA COLOR NEGRO ,ELLA TIENE EL CABELLO CORTO
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, single, and has two dependent children.  She is a member of the "Paz y Bien" group.  Nancy currently works selling mixed vegetables and fresh vegetables in El Tambo market.  She works from very early in the morning every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday.  Nancy requested this loan so that she could increase her business by purchasing more merchandise.  In the future, she would like to have a larger stall in El Tambo market so that she can make more profits.

In the photo, Nancy is behind the lady wearing the orange-colored sweater.  She is wearing a jacket and black sweater and has short hair.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.ru:
Хидоят умная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и мать 3 детей. Более 10 лет она занимается куплей продажей детской обуви, и она набрала богатый опыт данному бизнесу. Хидоят занимается в данном бизнесе с удовольствием и любит свое дело.  Она всегда встречает своих клиентов с улыбкою, и обслуживает их с удовольствием. Она хочет, чтобы её клиенты всегда уходили с довольными лицами и приходили еще. Хидоят всегда старается, привозит качественные товары для своих клиентов. Она хотела бы получить  кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки новой ассортимент обуви. Она заранее хочет поблагодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Hidoyat is an intelligent and ambitious woman. She is married and the mother of three children. For more than ten years, she is involved in buying and selling children's shoes, and she gained valuable experience in this business. Hidoyat engages in this work with pleasure and loves her job. She always greets her customers with a smile and serves them with pleasure. She wants her customers to always leave with happy faces and more to come.Hidoyat always tries to bring quality products to her customers. She would like to receive a loan in the sum of US $3,000 to purchase a new assortment of shoes. She wants to thank in advance all the lenders for their support and encouragement.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 62 years old and she lives in Alindahaw, Tukuran, ZDS.  She is married with eight children. She has been engaged in various businesses. Aside from farming and pig raising, she also sells dried fish. Her husband is working on a fishing boat. She's been in the pig raising business for nine years. She's been a member of PMPC since 2008.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a reliable businessman who is 45 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last 13 years, he has been operating a carpentry business to support his family. His other source of income is farming. In the next 5 years, he wants the money he earns to educate his children. His dream is to buy a plot of land. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wood. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Mauro Gregorio

texts.es:
Mauro es un hombre padre de dos hijos pequeños de 3 y 7 años. Vive junto a su esposa e hijos en un barrio urbano marginal del cantón "Santo Domingo". Nos cuenta que el lugar donde vive carece de servicios básicos siendo esto un gran obstáculo ya que no cuentan con un seguro médico y las enfermedades de la familia son una preocupación diaria.
Mauro tiene un negocio de venta de pequeños juguetes plásticos, así como artículos de bisutería en un puesto ambulante. Lo ayuda su esposa, nos cuenta que aprendió este negocio por unos amigos y ya que tenía necesidad de trabajar para sostener su hogar. El tiene planes de incrementar su mercadería y comprar un horno que le permita fabricar bocadillos de comida rápida los cuales los pueda vender y así obtener mejores ingresos.

Como todo buen padre su más grande anhelo es poder ver a sus hijos profesionales y sobre todo dar una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mauro is the father of two young children, ages 3 and 7. He lives with his wife and children in a marginalized urban neighborhood in the canton of Santo Domingo. Mauro says that the place where he lives still lacks basic services, but his greatest obstacle is not having medical insurance. Illnesses in his family are a daily worry.

Mauro has a business selling small plastic toys and trinkets from a mobile stand. He has help from his wife. Mauro says he learned about the business from some friends since he needed the work to support his household. He plans to increase his merchandise and also buy an oven for making fast food snacks that he can sell as a way of generating more income.

Like any good father, his greatest wish is to see his children become professionals and provide his entire family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business and an oven for making fast food snacks to sell.

loans.name: Lucila Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Lucila tiene 30 años vivió en unión libre por más de 11 años, hace poco que se caso con el señor Antonio el cual trabaja de pintor, de dicho matrimonio nacieron América de 1 año con 9 meses y Brandon de 9 años el cual estudia tercero de primaria.
Doña Lucila tiene un negocio de comida corrida y tortillas en el cual vende quesadillas, tortas, sincronizadas, y las tortillas en la actividad lleva poquito escasamente 4 meses, su negocio lo abre todos los días de lunes a sábados y domingos descansa para estar un da con su familia. En donde cuenta con el apoyo de su mama.
En esta ocasión ha solicitado el crédito por que comprar maíz para las tortillas espera comprar 2 costales de 50 kilos. También comprara pintura para arreglar la fachada de su local ya que considera importante para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto cuando vallan a comer. Los ingredientes de la comida las compras cada 8 días, también piensa hacer un apartadito del crédito que le otorgaron para comprar lo que le haga falta en ese aspecto, ya que comenta que no le conviene comprar todo junto por que se le puede echar a perder.
El problema que presenta en estos momentos es la falta de maíz porque es el más caro pero con el crédito piensa comprar. La esperanza que tiene doña Lucila es que su negocio progrese,  tener más clientes y no pierde las esperanzas de poner otro negocio en otro lugar. 
“Gracias por el crédito ya que le ayudaron para poner su negocio y poco a poco ha levantado el negocio gracias a los bajos intereses”
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila is 30 years old and has been in a common-law relationship for more than 11 years to Sr. Antonio, who works as a painter. Their union has given birth to América, who is 1 year and 9 months old, and 9-year-old Brandon who is a third grade student.

Doña Lucila has a business selling tortillas and food-on-the-go, such as quesadillas and tortas (Mexican sandwiches). She has been in business for barely four months and is open all day Monday through Saturday. On Sundays, she takes a rest so that she can be with her family. In her business, Lucila receives help from her mother.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy corn for making tortillas. She plans to buy two bags that are 50 kilos each. Lucila will also buy paint so that she can remodel the façade of her shop because she feels it is important for her customers to feel comfortable while they eat. She buys ingredients for her dishes every eight days, so she will divide her loan into smaller amounts so that she can buy what she needs from that aspect. Lucila says that is not suitable to buy everything altogether because the goods can spoil.

Her problem at the moment is a lack of corn because the price is too expensive, so the loan will help her with this purchase. She hopes to see her business progress, acquire new customers, and not lose hope about starting another business elsewhere.

Lucila says, “Thank you for this loan which has helped me establish and gradually grow my business. Thank you for the low interest rates.”

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijos , su esposa labora como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar  , ya que tienen hijos y necesitan de su apoyo y cuidado , don José desde hace varios años labora como taxista , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es el alza del combustible ya que esto afecta sus ganancias y muy pocas personas optan por tomar un taxi por el costo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que no ah logrado cerrar parte de la casa lo cual esto le está afectando en gran parte por las lluvias que afectan en el invierno , a la vez quiere realizar un división entre la sala  y el cuarto ya que esta todo junto , lo cual no hay privacidad .Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva para mejor su calidad de  vida.
texts.en:
José lives in the town of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children.  His wife works as a saleswoman in order to help him cover their household expenses as they have children who need their care and support.  José has been working as a taxi driver for several years.  The biggest difficulty he faces is the rising price of fuel as this affects his profits and very few people choose to take a taxi because of the cost.

José's plan for his family is to improve their living conditions as he hasn't managed to close off part of his house and this is causing him problems because of the rain they get in the winter.  He would also like to build a dividing wall between his living room and bedroom because it is all one room right now and there is no privacy.  He is grateful for the support and trust he has received from Afodenic through their Kiva fund.  It has helped him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 45 years old and married with three children. To generate income, he works as a farmer in the Philippines, planting rice in their field. He can suffer with the heat of the sun, or the cold under the rain, just to take care of his crops in the field in order to feed his family.

He is proud to be a farmer. He has been running a rice field business for almost 21 years. Eduardo practices farming in order to provide the needs of his family. He has been getting farm supplies from the traders with a high interest rate. Now, Eduardo thinks that he can earn a higher income if he can find other lenders that will give him a minimal interest rate. 

He decided to borrow a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides to use in farming. The loan will be a big help for him to stop borrowing from the traders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Melecia has a pigpen that sells matured and grown pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 29,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Melecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Melecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 24 years old and married. For a living, he runs a motorbike transport business. He has been in the business for three years. Even though he runs his business in a very competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good services.

Douglas hopes to own a vehicle for transport in five years. He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheam works in a garment factory as a sewing worker. She has been engaged in this business since early 2011. She usually gets a monthly salary of approximately $80.  

At the age of 32, she is the mother of one child who is attending school. Her husband is a construction foreman, working in mobile places around the country. 

With the sum of KHR4,500,000, she will buy stock of cashew fruits from local villagers, and then she will continue selling them to tradesmen at a profitable price. In the future, she wants to decorate and fix her present house partially.

loans.use: to buy stock of cashew fruits from local villagers.

loans.name: Dinh's Group

texts.en:
Dinh is 45 years old. She has one child who is going to university. She has a shop. She is a tailor. She has had this job for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND).

She has participated in SEDA since 2010. She is a member of the Duc Lan cluster. The last time she borrowed 2,016,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 3,360,000 VND to buy cloth for her shop. 

About the other borrower in her group :

Thu is 47 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her shop

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is a 30-year-old widow. She has a boutique for the past 8 years. She has requested a loan to add more sugar, salt and beans to sell in her boutique. She hopes to use the profits from her business to create savings. She would like to have different marketplaces for her items in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and beans to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, and fried fish. She has done this for thirty-five years. She is a widow and has nine dependents. 

Esi uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees and other household expenses. Esi will use the loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit into her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tomatoes, and cooking oil for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.name: Rodrigo Eduardo

texts.es:
Rodrigo Eduardo tiene  27 años de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa, y con sus hijos de 4,1 año de edad viven en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de  mora.

Rodrigo Eduardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra de la mora. 

El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el beneficio de la familia y para invertir. El sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida.
Le gusta jugar volé  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Eduardo is 27 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their two children, aged 4 and 1, in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. The branch "Luz y Progreso" ("light and progress") of his communal bank is located in the municipality of San José de Guayabal, belonging to the canton of Chillanes. This branch provides loans for short-term agricultural activities, such as sowing blackberries.

Rodrigo Eduardo is a farmer who grows blackberries. He buys and sells his products in Chillanes.

He applies for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer to grow blackberries. The loan helps him to increase his income for the benefit of his family and to invest in his business. His dream is to increase his crop of blackberries in order to earn more money and thus have a better living standard.

He likes playing volleyball and going to the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer to grow blackberries.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs  avec  RAHAMA , 1ere assise de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women who average 41 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in Djigonso, a village in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali. 

This is their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. All past loans were correctly repaid.

The group sells maize through Rahama, sitting first from the right in the photo. She will use her loan to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1.25 hectares of land. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and at the market of San to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to earn an average profit of 185,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1.25 hectares of land.

loans.name: Maa Basantai Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Basantai SHG" self help group includes 12 women who work in the fields daily in tasks like raising cattle and agriculture. Some also work in the city doing a variety of things. They are friendly, gentle people who work every day to improve their household finances and offer a better future to their children. They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. They live around the coastal area of Odisha, India, a place full of vegetation and green fields. 

One of these members is Sandhyarani, the lady standing with her hand raised in the photo. Sandhyarani enjoys these loans because they invoke a unity in their group, solidarity and the desire to meet their goals together. Sandhyarani is 42 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works in agriculture. They live in their own house. 

Sandhyarani has worked in agriculture all her life. They consume the produce at home. She also raises goats and milk cows. The money from the loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her fields and feed for the animals. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Leo Xavier

texts.en:
Leo is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.He used his previous loan  to buy more fertilizers and manure for his farm. He currently deals in coffee buying and selling alongside growing of bananas and coffee and  waragi selling and with the proceeds from these businesses, He has been able to look after his family and increase on his earnings. His vision is to expand his current business but he has been challenged by price changes, inadequate capital and Bad weather. 

Leo is requesting for a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Monyrort

texts.en:
C. Monyrort is a farmer. He is living with his wife, three children and two younger brothers in a village near to Phnom Penh. He is growing rice and vegetables and owns 4 cows, which are very useful to plough his parcels of land. When the cows are too old to work, he sells them for their meat. He is rather experienced in raising cows and would like to turn this activity into a profitable business. His wife is running her own business, selling water spinach, she can make $5 per day.

C. Monyrort is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy an additional cow and to build a cow-house to shelter these precious animals. The cow will cost him between $500 and $700 while the materials (cement, wood and zinc mainly) for building the cow-house are worth $500. In addition to performing the works by himself, Monyrort will probably invest some of his own savings in the business too. The cow-house will be big enough for at least 10 animals and Monyrort might well buy one more with his next CREDIT loans.

loans.use: BUying a cow and building a cow-house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Lizzy sells local maize meal known as kenkey to a large community of about 2,600 people. She is a leader of her community and very energetic. Lizzy has participated in the TEACH lending methodology of Kraban Support Foundation. She wants $750 from Kiva to support her operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tuimema

texts.en: Tuimema is 33 years old.  She has two children who are in primary school.  She runs a small shop in the Samoan village of Sataoa.  She knows everyone in the village, and her friendly smile and kind words keep customers returning to her store.  She is confident that she can continue to expand her shop and is enthused at the future prospect of being owner of a large, successful store.  Tuimema is applying for a loan to help expand her product line and ensure a consistent supply of goods to the local customers.

loans.use: :  Buy merchandise for resale in her shop

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz A. is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is a lawyer by his education. He has had his own business for 3 years, and nobody helps him. He would like to earn more money and get married. He had US$200 when he began his business of selling toys. Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$1000 in order to go to China to buy more inventory of toys. At the moment he buys the toys from Istaravshan.

loans.use: To purchase new kinds of toys.

loans.name: Justa Benita

texts.es:
Justa Benita M. D. G. is 59 years old, is a widow, and has 4 children. She lives in the Centro Poblado D. Huanja, district of Jangas, in the province of Huaraz. Her main occupation is agriculture and the foods she harvests are for household consumption. She has been weaving since she was 15 years old, and works at weaving and selling ropes. She sells them in the markets that take place on Wednesday and Sundays in the in the province of Carhuaz, which is a ½ hour walking distance followed by a ½ hour by car. With this income she provides for her household. She belongs to the “La Flor D. Retama” Communal Bank, which is part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos that works in her community. She has requested a loan of S/. 300.00 ($95.00), to be paid back in 4 months, for the purpose of buying thread. Thread is the raw material for making multiple-use ropes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella es la Señora Justa Benita M. D. G. D. 59 años D. edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el Centro Poblado D. Huanja, distrito D. Jangas, provincia D. Huaraz. Su actividad principal es la agricultura y sus productos D. la cosecha es para autoconsumo, desD. hace 15 años se dedica al tejido y venta D. sogas, lo venD. en la feria que se realiza los miércoles y domingos en la provincia D. Carhuaz que esta aproximadamente a 1/2 hora D. camino a pie y 1/2 hora con carro desD. su comunidad. Con estos ingresos mantiene su hogar. Ella pertenece al BC comunal “La Flor D. Retama” promovido por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que funciona en su comunidad, solicitó un prestamos D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles ($ 95.00) pagaderos en 4 meses, para la compra D. hilos que es la materia prima para hacer las sogas para uso múltiple.

loans.use: To buy thread for making ropes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
