Ms. Nguyen Thi H., 44 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund since 1994. Before joining TYM Fund, her life was really difficult because she could not get any fund to start her business. Her family income comes from only a 5-acre corn-field. H.’s first loan from TYM Fund was 50USD. She used this money to buy soya to make soya curd and sell it to the villagers. She uses the profit from this small stall and her husband’s wage to pay the weekly repayment. She also uses the soya waste to feed the pigs. After 6 years, her loan now is 575USD. From this loan and the savings, she has expanded her business. Her customers now include not only the villagers but also the other soya curd sellers and restaurant owners near Noi Bai Airport. She sells up to 50 kg soya curd per day. At the same time, she buys material for fitting up electrical equipment services. Her family’s total income now increases to 225USD a month. This time she plans to borrow 1200USD to buy more soya to make soya curd and buy mash for her 10 pigs. She also wants to use this loan for fitting up electrical equipment services of her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiên, 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 1994. Cuộc sống gia đình chị những năm trước khi tham gia Quỹ khá vất vả vì không có vốn để tăng gia sản xuất, mọi chi tiêu chỉ trông vào 5 sào ruộng. Năm đầu tiên tham gia được vay 50 USD, chị đầu tư vào làm đậu phụ bán cho người dân trong thôn. Tiền lãi thu được cộng với tiền công làm thuê của chồng được dùng trả gốc lãi hàng tuần, ngoài ra bã đậu chị dùng để chăn nuôi lợn. Sau 6 năm liên tục vay vốn với mức vốn lên tới 575 USD, cộng với số tiền tích lũy được, chị đã mở rộng phạm vi bán hàng, không chỉ bán cho những hộ gia đình quanh đó mà còn bán buôn cho những người bán lẻ và các nhà hàng trong sân bay Nội Bài, lượng tiêu thụ lên tới 50 kg đậu/ngày. Đồng thời, chồng chị mua thêm vật tư, nhận lắp đặt các công trình điện nước, nâng tổng thu nhập bình quân cả gia đình lên 225 USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Hiên dự định vay 1200 USD để mua đậu tương làm đậu và chăn nuôi 10 con lợn hiện có trong chuồng. Phần vốn còn lại dành cho việc phát triển nghề lắp đặt điện nước của chồng.

loans.use: buy soya to make soya curd, buy mash for 10 pigs, for fitting up electrical equipment services of her husband

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo lives in his own house with his wife and children on Docweeiller Street in the Tacagua zone. He makes his living crafting winter parkas, jackets and other pieces of clothing. He works with his wife. She not only helps him cut and sew the clothing but also sells the products.

The loan Alfredo is requesting will go toward the purchase of a larger sewing machine with more options such as embroidery and other advanced functions that will improve the quality of his products. As a result of his history with IMPRO, we have qualified Alfredo as a preferred client with qualification "1" and full eligibility for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Alfredo vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Docweeiller de la zona de Tacagua; él se dedica a la confección de deportivos, parcas, chamarras y otros.Trabaja con su esposa; ella además de ayudarle a cortar y coser las prendas, vende el producto.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina mas grande que tenga mas opciones como ser bordar, coser overloock y pueda mejorar la calidad de sus prendas. Por su antecedente con Impro podemos calificarlo como cliente preferencial con calificación “1” y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Mohammad Mosa

texts.en: Mohammad Mosa lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own family. He is a doctor and also he has a drug store. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. He has good experience and he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to import more medicine from Iran and Pakistan to attract more clients and make good income to help his family.

loans.use: To import more medicine from Iran and Pakistan

loans.name: Nuru's Neema Group

texts.en:
Nuru, age 20, is married with a one-year-old. She and her husband also take care of her sisters, ages 15 and 10. Nuru owns a small cafe where she sells snacks and dishes from 7am to 8pm daily. She started this business in 2004 and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Nuru hopes for a loan to increase her food stock. She will share this loan with Anita, a member in her loan group.

loans.use: To increase food stock for cafe

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.en:
K. Zarnigor is 35 years old and raising two children by herself.

Zarnigor has been in business for 10 years as a seamstress making oriental dresses and pants.  The business generates a stable income for the family and is now ready for expansion. 

She is requesting a loan of $950.00 for a 9 month term  to purchase more fabrics required to sew the national dresses and pants. This is the first loan Zarnigor has requested and she thanks all supporting her and promises to be timely in loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing the national dresses and pants.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Ms. Tamara is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 45, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Tamara and her husband owns a small herd of cattle. On Saturdays, she sells the animals she breeds, buys calves, and starts to breed them again. The business is going well, but needs some improvements. Tamara plans to increase the number of calves she purchases to increase her income. Her family expenditures are increasing as her children grow. Tamara has applied to receive a $600 loan and has been approved by the Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will let her change her family life.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha E. is married and has three children. She owns a provision store and is running out of stock.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi A. is 26 years old and single with no children. He has an entrepreneurial spirit and opened a bar in Lavie, a small village near Kpalimé in Togo. He would like to use the Kiva funds to buy a motorcycle (like the one in the photo of his brother) to make it easier to carry goods for the bar. This will enable him to expand his business. He hopes to make a greater contribution to the expenses of his maternal family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Koffi A. est âgé de 26 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il a l’esprit d’entrepreneur et il a ouvert un bar à Lavie, un petit village proche de Kpalimé, Togo. Il souhaite avec les fonds de Kiva acheter une moto (comme la moto dans la photo de son frère) pour plus facilement transporter ses marchandises pour le bar. Ca va lui permettre d’augmenter la capacité de son entreprise. Il espère mieux participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille maternelle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Mrs. Raquel is 30 years old and lives in the "Hacienda La Enramada" (Arbor Estates) neighborhood of Ticuantepe. She is married and has two children, ages 1 and 9. Her husband works and covers the household expenses. Raquel has eleven years of experience selling meats, a business she began with her own money. The loan she is requesting is for household improvements and the expansion of one of the bedrooms. In the future she hopes to improve the living conditions for her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Raquel tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio casa hacienda la enramada en Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Raquel vende carne, tiene once años de experiencia e inició con fondos propios. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras de vivienda en la ampliación de un cuarto de habitación. A futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida para su pequeña hija.

loans.use: Expansion of a bedroom

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru:
Nasimjon N. is an experienced farmer. He had been in this business for the last 10 years. He is married and has 3 children. He leases land, which he uses to plant various vegetables and fruits. To prepare for the fall season, he would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months. This credit will help him purchase seeds at lower prices because later, during the season, the prices of seeds and fertilizers are going to be a higher. Currently, he is collecting crops of melons and watermelons.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Намозов Насимджон дехканин со стажем. Десят лет работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Женат , имеет троих детей. Арендует участок земли, который засеивает различными культурами. Для того , чтобы подготовиться к осеннему посеву хочет получить кредит и закупить необходимые семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев. Получение кредита даст возможность закупить семена по более низкой цене, так как в сезон цены на этот вид продукции подорожает .В даннвй момент он собирает урожай арбузов и дынь.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sukhrob

texts.ru:
Хафизов Сухроб, 1983 года рождения, женат и у них один ребенок. После оканчания медицинского института работал как продавец в нескольких аптеках города. Наращивая свой опыт в этом бизнесе, Сухроб решил заняться собственным бизнесом и открыть собственный аптечный киоск. Он арендовал помещение в тарговом центре «Илхом» и вот уже 3 года является владельцем аптечного бизнеса в городе Вахдат. У него в продаже все наиболее используемые медикаменты, лечебные травы, косметические средства, зубные пасты, принадлежности по уходу за ребенком и т.д. Товар Сухроб закупает в фирме «Рахмат - 2004» города Душанбе.
С помощью программы КИВА хочет получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для покупки медикаментов и холодильника для хранения лекарственных препаратов.
texts.en:
Sukhrob K. was born in 1983 and is married with one child. Upon graduation from medical school, he worked as a pharmacist in several pharmacies of his city. Having gained experience, Sukhrob decided to start his own business and opened his own pharmacy. He rented space at Ilhom mall and for the past three years has owned and operated a pharmacy business in Vakhdat town. Sukhrob sells all major medications, herbs, personal and baby care products, toothpastes, etc. He buys the product from the Rahmat-2004 company in Dushanbe. With Kiva's help Sukhrob would like to obtain a loan of 4100 somoni (1200 USD) in order to purchase more medications and a refrigerator for storing them.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase medications and a refrigerator

loans.name: Som-Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. Som-ang C., 54, is widow with seven children; three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son is married and lives outside the family home. The second son is a policeman, and the youngest son attends a local school. One daughter sells vegetables and meat, and the other three daughters study in a local school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Som-ang has been a silk weaver since 1968, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband died in early 2008. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase vegetables, meat, and fish for her daughter to sell in front of her house.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, meat, and fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
A la casa de la familia C. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso ya que el que tiene es piso vinílico y está en malas condiciones. El Sr. Francisco y su esposa María de Lourdes quieren un hogar mejor para sus hijos.
El Sr. Francisco trabaja en una compañía en el área de auxiliar de plomería éste es el ingreso de su familia ya que sus esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos. 
Francisco está solicitando un préstamo para poner el vitropiso en su casa y mejorar el lugar donde vive su familia.
Cuando se realizó la visita a la casa del  Sr. Francisco no se encontraba es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa e hijo.
texts.en:
The C. family’s home needs a “vitropiso” (tiled floor) since that the one it has is in bad condition. Señor Francisco and his wife María De Lourdes want a better home for their children and to have a better place to live in.

Señor Francisco works for a company as a plumber’s assistant which is his family's only income now that his wife María De Lourdes cares for their children.

Francisco is asking for a loan to be able to put a “vitropiso” (tiled floor) in his home and to improve the place where his family lives.

When we visited the C. home only his wife, Señora Maria De Lourdes, and his son were home and Señor Francisco was at work which is why only his wife and son are in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing of a "vitropiso" (tiled floor) in the house

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia G. vive en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada (el marido tiene el oficio de policía) y tiene 4 hijos. La pareja tiene domicilio propio, necesita crédito para la construcción de un muro perimetral. Este es el primer crédito de Virginia pero dados los resultados de nuestra evaluación, estamos seguros de que no tendrá problemas para hacer los pagos correspondientes
texts.en:
Virginia G. lives in the Bajo Llojeta Zone of La Paz. She is married to a police officer and they have four children. The couple own their own home, and are requesting this loan so that they can build a wall around it. This is Virginia's first loan, but our evaluation shows that she will have no problem making the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the construction of a wall

loans.name: Albino Govene

texts.pt:
Albino nasceu em Gaza, tem 59 anos de idade estudou ate 2ª classe do antigo sistema  é pai de 3 filhos: com idades compriendidas entre os 22 aos 17 anos de idade, as duas mais velhas encontram-se no lar e a mais nova e que vai a escola.
Albino iniciou os seus estudos com 15 anos, após concluir a 2 ªclasse teve que interroper os estudos devido aos maus tratos dos seus professores na escola, pois ele não era assimilado porque os seus progenitores não tinham condições finãnceiras pois estes eram camponesês. Sai de chókwe para Maputo  a procura de emprego.chegado a maputo consegue aranjar um emprego no Hotel Rovuma como servente e trabalhou durante 5 anos, porque o salário  não satisfazia as suas necessidades, abandona o emprego apos  ter  tido uma proposta para trabalhar no Hotel Libombos em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia, trabalhou  durante 2 anos porque não havia um bom ambiente de trabalho pois os colegas alegavam que o cargo que ele ocupava não lhe marecia e assim teve que abandonar o emprego. Mas com o fundo colectado e com ajuda da sua mulher esta que é modista, albino  inicia o seu próprio negócio de alfaiataria e sapataria, uma actividade que aprende com as irmãs missionarias quando ainda frenquentava a escola. Hoje é dono de uma sapataria e alfaiataria denominada “chapo-chapo’’  trabalha das 7h as 18h excepto quartas e sabados porque tem estado no mercado imformal que funciona 2 vezes por semana, tem tido mais rendimento nos sapatos pois solicitam muito os seus servicos principalmente no tempo chuvoso pois os sapatos descolam se com frequência devido a lama argilosa que se faz sentir naquela época. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 5.000.00mt  e consegue poupar 1.500.00mt porque não responsabiliza se por ninguem pois ele e o único na familia que sobriviveu na guerra dos 16 anos.
Este é o segundo empréstimo de albino na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 5.000.00mt usou para comprar uma maquina de engrachar sapatos e pede este segundo de 11.000.00mt para comprar uma maquina de costura, pois no inicio do ano tem tido muitas encomendas de uniforme escolar e pretende satisfazer as necessidaes dos clientes na totalidade e render mais ainda.
texts.en:
Albino was born in Gaza. He is 59 years old. He went to school until the 2nd grade under the old system. He is the father of 3 children with ages between 17 and 22. The two oldest are at home, and the youngest is in school. Albino began his studies when he was 15 years old, but after finishing the 2nd grade he had to interrupt school due to the bad treatment from his teachers at his school. Of course he was not very assimilated because his ancestors did not have the financial conditions being that they were country folk. He left Chókwe for Maputo in search of work. Having arrived in Maputo he was able to arrange a job at the Hotel Rovuma as a servant and worked for 5 years. Because he salary did not satisfy his necessities he abandoned his job after having had a proposal to work in the Hotel Libombos in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. He only worked there 2 years because it was not a very good work environment. His colleagues alleged that he did not deserve the responsibilities he was given and he had to leave. But with the funds collected and with the help of his mother who is a dressmaker, Albino started his own tailor and shoe shop, an activity that he learned from the sister missionaries when he was still attending school. Today he is the owner of a shoe store and tailor called "Chapo-Chapo". He works from 7:00am until 6:00pm except on Wednesdays and Saturdays because he goes to the informal market 2 times per week. He makes more income from the shoes. Of course many people need his services during the rainy season because the shoes become unglued frequently due to the muddy clay that made sense during that time. He has had a monthly income of 5,000MT and is able to save 1,500MT because he is not responsible for anyone else. He is the only one in his family that survived the 16 year war. This is Albino's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 5,000MT was used to purchase a machine to clean shoes, and he is asking for this second loan of 11,000MT to purchase a sewing machine because since the beginning of the year he has had many orders for school uniforms, and he intends to satisfy the necessities of his customers in full and bring in more money as well.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana M. M. lives in Pucallpa, Peru. It is the district capital of the Ucayali department in the hot, humid jungle region of eastern Peru. Liliana is twenty-eight years old and is married to a taxi driver; together they have one small child. Liliana is a member of the Talented Women community bank and has taken out small business loans through her group for one and a half years.

Liliana is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to help her purchase groceries and foodstuffs to implement her business. Liliana sells meals to a casino, preparing them in her home and dropping them off at the casino every evening at eight pm for sale. With her Kiva loan, Liliana will purchase rice, potatoes and onions among others. She will repay the loan in four monthly installments.

loans.use: purchase rice, potatoes and onions among other foodstuffs to prepare meals

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda S. is her name, and she is a 42-year-old woman, married, and mother of six kids. Four of the children are currently in school in the community where they live, while two are independent.

Linda has been a food vendor for three years, selling kenkey. Through this she has sent her kids to school. She prepares and sells kenkey in Abofour, a farming community where she lives with her household. Aside from this business, she also sells raw food products like maize in the market place of Abofour, mostly during their market days on Thursdays. The food she prepares is a delicious dish that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday either as breakfast, lunch or dinner, especially where she lives. Her business is doing well, and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, firewood, sugar etc. for her operation. She also wants to use part of the money to provide education for her kids. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance. Linda belongs to a village bank (loan group) called ‘Sarah’. She also hopes to receive GH¢400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Mrs. Saret U. is a villager in Kraing Touch Village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food for her breeding. She is a 46-year-old mother with a child who is a horse cart driver making a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more duck and duck food for her breeding.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is forty-nine years old. She is a married woman and has seven children. Five of them are currently pursuing education in junior and senior high schools. Comfort’s husband is a food crop farmer. Comfort and her family live in a family house at Nkwaateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Nkwaateng are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of businesses.

Comfort trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bedspreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc. from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Comfort has been in this business for seven year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Courage Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро замужем ей 45 лет, у нее 5 детей. Имеет среднее специальное образование. Она торгует женским бельем, носками и другими вещами. На рынке торгует 20 лет. Основной товар который реализуется это носки и махси (национальные носки из кожи). Ее бизнес расширяется год от года. За товаром ездит сама. Она привозит товар, а иногда дает деньги своим знакомым , они являются соседями по бизнесу. Благодаря поддержке КИВА она развивает свой ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Zuhro is married, she is 45 years old and has five children. She has specialized secondary education. She sells women's undergarments, socks and other clothing. She has been selling on the market for 20 years. Mainly what sells well is socks and mahsi (Tajik national socks from leather). Her business is expanding each year. Zuhro travels for the merchandise herself. She brings over the goods, but sometimes she pays her business neighbors. Thanks to Kiva's support she is expanding the variety of goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 51 years old and she is married with 8 children. She sells women's clothes and shoes and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more women's clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Khursheed Zulfiqar Masih Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is a 55-year-old married mother of two who has lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 35 years. Her husband is named Z. M. and he runs a small hotel in the community, where he also sells Punjabi foods.  He has 6 years of experience in this business.  Khursheed baji helps her husband by cooking Punjabi foods.  And the hotel is known for its delicious foods!  Khursheed baji has a son who earns income as an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and her daughter currently studies in the 7th standard.  Khursheed baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now she is applying for another loan to replace the body of her son's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Khursheed baji is the leader for this group loan which includes three other women from her locality. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  Shamshad baji will use the loan to buy religious books for her book shop, Razia baji needs a loan to repair the engine of her vehicle (named “Shahzore”), and Irshad begum baji plans to buy a welding machine.  The members of a group loan mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To replace the body of an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Gun Keshari

texts.en:
Mrs. Gun Keshari M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho village. She opened her grocery shop 6 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits and noodles in her shop. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Rupees to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

Mrs. Gun Keshari M. had already taken a first loan from Kiva and had cleared her loan. The previous loan helped her to raise the level of income from her shop.

Mrs. M. lives with her mother-in-law, husband and one son. Her husband is Shiva Das M. and is a farmer. Her son is studying in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị (1420030447) is a 40 year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  N. is requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND to be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 7th loan taken out by N. from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Pepa

texts.en:
Pepa T., 52, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~260 USD). She has two previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Pepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, sacks of fertilizers and a gallon of herbicide

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is already 34 years old and is married to Francis B. Sr. The couple manages a rice farming business which is the major source of income for their family. Fe also manages a general store so that her family has an extra source of income to support their daily needs.

She wants to expand her store and to increase her daily income so she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5000 for additional working capital.

Major proceeds of her daily income go toward the education of her children who are Xyril Aian Jay (10 years), Francis B. Jr. (7 years), Justine (6 years), and the youngest, Jasper (4 years).

She hopes that she can continue to support the schooling of her children until they finish their studies in college. Fe is thankful that in spite of the hardships of life, her family still lives happily in the simple village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is a member of the Uamsho borrower group in Kola, Mororgoro. She is a 26-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of a 3-year-old child. She also cares for three other dependents.

Marry started her own business selling drinks 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Marry's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 TZS to buy more drinks to sell. With the additional profit from this loan, Marry hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 64 years old. Josefina is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Josefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.en: Rosa is a member of The Orchids village bank. Rosa is 47 years-old. She is separated and has two children who work. Rosa makes lunch specials to sell at a company. She gets up very early to prepare the lunch specials because she distributes them before 1:00 p.m. Each day, she sells 45 lunches and people pay her at the end of each month. Rosa needs a new loan for 1,200 soles to buy supplies, such as bags of rice, sugar, potatoes, and meat. Her dream is to have a restaurant and she is working hard to fulfill her dream. This is Rosa's third loan. Click to read about Rosa's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as bags of rice, sugar, potatoes, and meat.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha isa 43 year married with six children aged between 4and 20 years All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members Aisha resides and owns three roomed house where she is staying with six people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week. Aisha owns and mandazi and moves Door to Door in Kawempe. She buys baking flour and cooking oil from Kikuubo one of the busiest places in Kampala city.  Aisha doesn’t pay rent for business premises She uses public transport to and from shopping.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole saleAisha has been with MCDT for eight year servicing her twenty fourth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more baking flour cooking oil and cow peas She is aspiring of employing at least 20 employees.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil nad baking flour

loans.name: Banaris Group

texts.en: Banaris is the loan group leader. He is married and the father of two children. He lives in Jalalabad city. With hard work, Banaris organized a loan group of of three members, each one of them busy with different tasks. Banaris is a taxi driver. Noor M. has a business in used metals and ZainuD. is busy with leather working. They want to strengthen their businesses so they formed this loan group and have requested a group loan with each member needing 10000 (AF) to further their work.  Banaris assures that they can repay the loan on time and he can control the whole group. He would like to thank everyone at kiva for making this lending process available in Afghanistan and another poor counties.

loans.use: They want to increase their operating funds and supplies.

loans.name: Hermine Vicentia Adjou

texts.fr: H. Hermine Vicentia Adjou est née le 30 Novembre 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBAGUIDI Natal, un commerçant, Hermine Vicentia Adjou est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Hermine Vicentia Adjou vit depuis quatre ans à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou. Hermine Vicentia Adjou supporte les charges de la famille ensemble avec Natal. Hermine Vicentia Adjou n'a pas fréquenté l'école pendant longtemps, et s'est arrêtée au niveau primaire. Il y a deux ans de cela que Hermine Vicentia Adjou a commencé la vente de tissus, chaussures et de nounours à son domicile et également par le système de distribution. Hermine Vicentia Adjou s'approvisionne à Cocotomey, à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Hermine Vicentia Adjou est à son premier crédit. En effet, Hermine Vicentia Adjou sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le volume de son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
H. Hermine Vicentia Adjou was born on November 30, 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to GBAGUIDI Natal, a merchant, and is the mother of four children who are all in school. For four years, she has been living in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. Together with Natal, she is covering family expenses. Hermine Vicentia Adjou hasn’t attended school for a long time, having stopped in primary school. Two years later, she started selling cloth, shoes, and teddy bears at her home and also via the distribution system. She stocks up in Cocotomey, in Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin, and also in Lomé in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. This is her first loan. She’s basically requesting this loan to increase her business volume and to grow her customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bales of teddy bears, four bolts of cloth, and a dozen shoes

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es una mujer muy trabajadora de 40 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar, cultivar y cuidar de sus cultivos de café y plátanos. Ella trabajan con mucha constancia y esmero, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y cuando terminar las labores en sus chacras, van atrabajar en las chacras de sus vecinos, donde la pagan a 13 soles y a su esposo 15 soles. 
Con estas ganancias adicionales a sus cultivos, Lorenza busca mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Por ello sueña en incrementar sus chacras de café, para dejar de trabajar como jornalera.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y tiene toda la predisposición de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir contando con otros préstamos posteriores. El dinero que solicita es para que comprar semillas de café para hace un vivero.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a hard working 40-year old woman who lives with her partner, father, and 4 children. Together with her husband, she dedicates herself to planting, cultivating and caring for her coffee and banana crops. She works consistently and with enthusiasm, from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. After she finishes tending to her own farmland, they go to neighbors’ lands to work, where she earns 13 soles and her husband 15 soles. With the additional earnings, Lorenza seeks to improve the standard of living for her children. She dreams of increasing her production of coffee so she can discontinue seeking out extra work on other peoples’ lands. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to paying her installments on time, since she wants to be able to rely on additional credit in the future. The funds she is requesting will be used to buy coffee plant seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plant seeds.

loans.name: Francis Ivania

texts.es: La señora Francis L. García tiene 29 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos menores de edad. La señora Francis tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos variados, joyas, cosméticos como mercadería en general además que también vende ropa, tanto nueva como usada.  Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  8 años, este negocio lo empezó debido a que ya tenía experiencia en este tipo de actividades ya que anteriormente le ayudaba a su mama en la distribución de productos de cosméticos. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente por encargo, y también vende a crédito. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de inventario de ropa, joyas y zapatos, ya que se acerca una fecha buena para la venta de estos productos, y ella desea aprovecharla. El sueño que ella siempre ha tenido con respecto a su negocio es llegar a tener una tienda bastante grande en la que distribuya todos sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francis L. García is 29 years old, and married with two dependent children. She has a business selling various shoes, jewelry, and cosmetics, as well as general merchandise including clothing, both new and used. She started this business 8 years ago, because she already had experience in this field since she helped her mom distribute cosmetic products. She makes her sales by orders, and she sells on credit.

This loan will be invested in buying inventory of clothing, jewelry and shoes, since a good season for selling these products is approaching, and she wants to take advantage of it. The dream she always had with respect to her business is to have a rather large store in which she can distribute her products wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en: Neonita S. is 53 years old and her husband, Reynaldo, works as a carpenter. For the past twenty years the couple have tried very hard to have a child but they have not been blessed by one. They live in the village of Barangay Bilan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Neonita wants only to continue her business and live a simple life. Even though she has no children to care for and prepare for their education, Neonita wants to make their living more comfortable and to save a portion of their income for their future. This triggered Neonita to open a general store. The small business is adjacent to their house where she earns a small amount because she only sells important goods for households until such time as she is able to expand her business which will benefit her. In 2001, Neonita became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and was able to get a loan for her general store. From the loan and business income, her general store is maximized and has contributed tremendously to the family. As her loans continue, her business improves and now earns a minimum of Php 10,000 per month which she uses for their expenses but saves most of it for her future. Neonita's previous loan of Php 15,000 was utilized for her general store and it was fully repaid in full and on-time without delay. Now on her 14th loan, she is borrowing the same amount of Php 15,000 as an additional working capital for her business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M., 58 years old, is a rice farmer. She is also a snack vendor in the schools. She said she earns much money by selling food in schools. The income she gets from her businesses is helpful in buying her family adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. She is looking for other means to augment her income. She admitted that she needs additional money to support her farm.

She would like to request a loan of 8,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest and her income as well. She likes the CEVI program because it charges only 2% interest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una amable mujer de 41 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su único hijo Jack de 18 años. Ella siempre ha sido independiente, es por eso no le afectó mucho la separación de su esposo, ya su propósito siempre fue salir adelante.

Desde hace 22 años es servidora pública (trabajadora en una entidad gubernamental) en una provincia bastante amplia geográficamente. A ella le gusta estar en permanente contacto con las personas, por lo que desde hace 5 años vende productos de belleza, así como algunos productos alimenticios. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene plantaciones de plátanos, palta y maíz, y para esta actividad recibe la ayuda de sus padres, quienes consideran a Sonia una persona “mil oficios” porque es muy activa. 
A su edad siente que el trabajo de oficina la absorbe y hasta le incomoda por la presión y exigencia que recibe; por ello, su mayor anhelo es vivir en el campo, ya que los cultivos le transmiten la tranquilidad que requiere. Las actividades a las que se dedica son bastante rentables, y con ellos logra cubrir las necesidades prioritarias de su familia. 
Para el futuro, planea ser una vendedora estrella de la marca de productos que ofrece y consume, además de aumentar su producción agrícola.

Esta es la cuarta vez que accede a un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta, además menciona que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son exigentes, responsables y cumplen a cabalidad las reglas internas, como debe de ser, siempre guardando el respeto por los demás. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y alimenticios que se encuentren a precios de promoción.
texts.en:
Sonia, 41, is a pleasant woman, who lives in her own home with her son, Jack, 18. She has always been independent so she wasn’t much bothered by her separation from her husband; her aim in life has always been to get ahead. She has been a public servant for the last 22 years (she works for a government entity) in a very large province. She likes to be in permanent contact with people so, for the last 5 years, she has sold beauty products as well as some food items. Besides, she’s also a farmer; she has banana, avocado and corn crops. For this last activity, she gets help from her parents who consider Sonia a “Jack-of-all-trades” because she is so active. At her age, she feels that her office work is all-consuming and the pressure and demands made on her sometimes are uncomfortable. Because of this, her greatest wish is to be able to live in the countryside since farming provides her with the tranquility she needs. Her activities are quite profitable and, thanks to them, she is able to meet her family’s main needs. For the future, she would like to be a star saleswoman of the products she offers and consumes as well as increasing her farming output. This is her fourth loan request to MFP and she is very happy. She also states that she enjoys working with her communal bank because the members are exacting, responsible, and follow the by-laws well, as it should be, always respectful of others. The funding she is requesting now will be used to buy beauty and nutritional products that are currently offered at discounted prices.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and nutritional food items.

loans.name: Kumrigul

texts.ru: Кавоева Кумригул проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Кавоева Кумригул торговлей занимается более 5 лет. Она торгует в своем собственном магазине. Кавоева Кумригул покупает и продает продукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Kumrigul K. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 53 years old; married with 4 children. Kumrigul has been a vendor for over 5 years. She has her own store. Kumrigul buys and sells goods. She is requesting the loan to increase her sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales turnover

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora sells tubers of yams, plantain, and cocoa yam to earn a living. Yams in Nigeria can be eaten by boiling, frying, pounding and roasting. They are a staple food in Nigeria and Nigerians love them.  Dora hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She is 52 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe is a businesswoman. She sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit and so she does not incur debt in her business. She hopes to own a drink company in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is a friendly and happy woman. She uses her friendly nature to attract and retain more customers to her business. 

Dupe is married with 3 children. Her children are excelling in school and business. To help his wife support the family, Dupe’s husband sells plates and pots. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: este cliente es originario de la cuidad de leon, ha resibido diferentes creditos con el animo de mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que ha tenido varios creditos, como construccion de vivienda, compra de motos,y este ultimo para lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a native of the City of Leon. He has received a number of different loans with the objective of improving his living standard. He has already had a number of loans that he used for construction on his house, to buy a moto-taxi, and this one for the purpose mentioned (to buy a computer.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline A. A. is taking a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy kale, tomatoes and onions to grow her business. The business is located at Nyamasaria market in Kisumu. Nyamasaria is a new open-air market which has a lot of potential for growth.

Seline has been selling vegetables to the local people for the last seven years. She plans to grow these vegetables herself to sell, which would be much cheaper than buying and reselling them.

Seline is thirty-five years old, is married, and has five children to whom she hopes to give education to university level. She describes herself as hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To buy more kale, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma V. is from the city of Ozamiz. She is 46 years old, is married, and has one adult child.

Alma owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In July 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC.

Alma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en:
Didacienne was born in 1968. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 15. Didacienne’s husband is a farmer. They both work hard to providing the necessities for their family. 

Didacienne owns a small shop in which she sells a variety of clothes to men and women. The hours of her business are from 6:00 a.m. in the morning to 8:00 p.m. in the evening every day except Sunday. This business is very fruitful in her region.

Didacienne is now requesting her second from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business and satisfy the demands of her clients. This loan will help her to earn more profits simply because she will be able to attract more customers with her good qualities and large quantities

loans.use: To buy various clothes for men and women

loans.name: Rosa Místico Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Rosa Mística del barrio San Miguel, actualmente se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Cada integrante se encuentra satisfecha con la actividad que realiza así como la señora Mirta A. quien tiene una despensa donde ofrece varios artículos para la casa. 
Actualmente quiere ampliar su negocio para abastecer a otras despensas de la zona y para ello debe compra mercaderías en mayor cantidad para distribuirlos.
Solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de panificados, lácteos, fideos, enlatados, embutidos y otros productos de consumo masivo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Rosa Mistica committee from the San Miguel neighborhood is currently in its fifth loan cycle from the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs). Each member is happy with the work that she does such as Mrs. Mirta Alcarez. She has a shop where she sells articles for the house. She now wants to expand her business to supply other stores in the area and for that reason she wants to buy merchandise in bigger quantities to distribute. She is asking for a loan to buy bread, dairy products, noodles, canned goods, cold cuts and other products of general consumption.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, dairy products, canned goods, cold cuts, noodles, cleaning supplies

loans.name: Fidel Tadeo

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, trabaja como herrero construye lampas; el oficio lo aprendio de sus abuelos. El destino del credito es para compra de herramientas y materiales
texts.en:
The applicant is single and works as a blacksmith making lamps. This is a trade that he learned from his grandparents. The loan will be used to purchase tools and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in western Kenya, and aside from his dairy business, he also produces tea.  He's been in business for 18 years, and employs one other person on his farm.  

Joseph is 53, married, and has 6 children between 5 and 22; all of them are in school.  

Joseph dreams of building a modern dairy unit and improving the breed of his cows to larger and more productive ones in the future.  His challenges include a lack of sufficient funds to meet the demands of a high-quality dairy cow, and poor infrastructure that make it difficult to transport milk to the market.

Joseph believes that with this additional dairy cow, he'll be able to borrow a larger loan next year, which will help him expand his businesses.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Juan; él socio  tiene 60 años de edad y El socio es casado, El es natural de la provincia de Puno del distrito de Juliaca, El socio vino a vivir a la ciudad del Cusco, desde hace más de 20 años el es comerciante y entre ir y traer mercadería de Juliaca  Cusco quedó enamoradísimo de esta bella ciudad y se quedó  a vivir en Cusco, ahora El socio se dedica al comercio en el rubro de especias, él vende  (aceitunas de diversos tipos, y otras especias). El socio tiene su stand en el mercado de Ttio, y cada mañana muy temprano lo limpia y abre su negocio, es muy conocido y muy amable. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y abastecer su negocio de venta de especias.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This is a member of the communal bank “LAS PALMERAS”; he lives in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province and Cusco department. Mr. Juan is 60 years old and married. He is from the Puno province and Juliaca district. He lives in the city of Cusco, and has been a trader for more than 20 years. Between going to bring merchandise to Juliaca Cusco, he fell in love with this beautiful city and went to live in Cusco. He is a merchant in the business of spices (selling olives of various types and other spices). He has a stand in the Ttio market, and very early every morning he cleans and opens his business. He is well known and very friendly. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and to stock his business selling spices. He is infinitely grateful as the granted loan will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. At the same time he is committed to paying his dues on time.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and to stock his business selling spices

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai T. N. is 37 years old. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune with her husband and two children. She and her husband are farmers. They grow rice and they also sell meat in the market. They have a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietamdong (VND). Mrs Mai has had this job for many years. She has participated in SEDA since 2005. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND for her business.
 
About other borrowers in her group:
 Chung T. N. is 58 years old, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed poultry and raise vegetables.
 Toan T. N. is 58 years old. She has a store. She would like to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: to small business

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal es empleado publico en la Policia; la esposa trabaja como empleada domestica; tienen un hijo, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona de San Roque de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de cemento y ladrillo para refaccionar su vivienda y construir dos habitaciones  pues actualmente viven en una sola habitación.
Es el Cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en:
Vidal is a public employee with the Police. His wife works as a housekeeper. They have one son. They live in the Zona de San Roque in the city of El Alto. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase cement and bricks to refurbish his home and to construct two rooms, as the family currently lives in a single room. This is his fourth loan with IMPRO and the second with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to construct two rooms in his home, in order to live more comfortably.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora:  Virginia L. quien es  vendedora de ropas , de la ciudad Parques del Sur   de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, ella recorre a pie todo el barrio por la mañana y por la tarde levantando pedidos entre  los vecinos, en cuanto se entero sobre el programas para mujeres de la Fundación se interesó muchísimo acerca del crédito., pues seria de buena ayuda tanto para ella como para su grupo.
Las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio de la Señora Virginia L.  una señora muy activa, trabajadora y todas las del grupo también todas son mujeres que sigen adelante con su esfuerzo y  tener cada una su puesto de trabajo para poder sobrellevar a sus hijos y a ellas mismas. 
La señora Virginia solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, pantalones, camperas, buzos, camisas.
texts.en:
This group came together thanks to Mrs.Virginia L., who sells clothing in Parques del Sur, of the Villa Elisa city. She goes through the whole neighborhood in the morning and afternoon getting orders from her neighbors. When she found out about the program for women at the Foundation, she became very interested in the loans, because they would be of much help to her and her group. The meetings take place at the home of Mrs. Virginia L., a very active and hard working woman. All the women in the group continue to get ahead through hard work, each having her job to allow her to take care of her children and of herself. Mrs. Virginia is requesting the loan for the purchase of T-shirts, pants, jackets, sweatshirts, and shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, pants, jackets, and other clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 30 year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and one child. Hussein has worked in construction since 2002. Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua because he wants to buy a crane for his work with concrete and a generator. His reputation helped in increasing his clients and income. Hussein seeks perfection in his work, and hopes to expand his construction work in the future

loans.use: To buy a crane and a generator

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
Delfín es un padre de familia de 69 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, una zona bastante conocida en el norte por sus danzas y costumbres afro – peruanas, se encuentra ubicado a  más de 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar granos y cereales, el se ha valido esta actividad para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora estos ya se han disipado, lo cual le llena de orgullo, aún así el sigue trabajando en esta actividad para ganarse el sustento diario.

Actualmente el ha instalado el cultivo de maíz y se encuentra trabajando para poder obtener una buena producción. Delfín se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo.

El es una persona que tiene bastante conocimiento acerca del manejo de cultivo gracias a la experiencia que tiene en el rubro. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Delfín is a 69-year old father who lives with his family in the district of Zaña, a zone well known in the north for its Afro-Peruvian dances and costumes. It is located more than 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has dedicated himself to farming since he was a young boy, and has some land where he plants grains and cereals. This activity has served him well in supporting and raising his children, who have now moved on, which fills him with pride. Despite the fact that they are grown, he continues ahead with this activity in order to earn a daily living. Currently, he is growing corn and finds himself working hard to yield a good harvest. Delfín is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he thinks he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crops. He is a person that knows a great deal about farming thanks to the experience he has in this arena. His neighbors and friends consider him a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and married with two children, ages 2 and 4. Both children attend school. He is a dairy farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for the last two years. He employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk which he sells to the local market including hotels. He also earns income from his motorbike transport business.

Peter has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him with the education of his children. His biggest challenge has been disease which is costly to treat. In five years' time, he would like to increase his land from the current 0.5 acre to 5 acres to enable him to increase his dairy business. He appreciates the fact that Juhudi has put him a step closer to owning a dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
El grupo Restauración lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Liliam C. de 50 años quien es comerciante de cosméticos, productos Arabela y prendas de oro y plata. En el 2000 inicio su negocio con la venta de comida y con los préstamos invirtió en otros negocios como cosméticos, ropa usada y bisutería. 
C. tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales los dos menores de 17 y 16 años están con ella y por los cuales trabaja arduamente. El sueño de esta fémina es tener un negocio más surtido es por ello que el crédito lo invertirá en ropa y cosméticos. 
Los integrantes del grupo son Justina R. quien vende leche gaseosa, chiverías, arroz, azúcar, jabón…etc. desde hace dos años e Isabel R. propietaria de una pequeña pulpería en la que invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Restauración” (Restoration) group is comprised of three hard-working people.  Liliam C., age 50, is one of them.  She sells cosmetics, Arabela products, and gold and silver jewelry.  She started her business in 2000; she sold food.  She used the loans to invest in other businesses like cosmetics, used clothes, and jewelry.

Liliam C. has four children.  The two youngest, ages 17 and 16, are with her.  She works arduously for them.  This woman’s dream is to have a better stocked business.  She will buy clothes and cosmetics with the loan.
 
Justina R. is another member of the group.  She sells milk, soft drinks, snacks, rice, sugar, and soap, etc.  

The other member of the group is Isable Romera.  She has a small grocery store, and she will use the loan to invest in it.

loans.use: Cosmetics, gold and silver jewelry, and Arabela products

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y con grado de instrucción de secundaria incompleta.
Yovana tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, los productos son comprados desde Desaguadero y entregados por mayor en Puno. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis meses, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitió comprar algunos productos de menor precio. 
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño es progresar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the communal bank "Bartolina Sisa," located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 25 years old, married, and has completed only part of a high school education. 

Yovana has a business selling groceries, products that she buys from Desaguadero and delivers at wholesale to Puno.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 6 months.  The first loan she requested was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to buy some products at a lower price.

She is requesting a new loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles that she will use to increase the working capital in her business.  

Her dream is to make progress with her business.  What she likes about her communal bank are the easy payment terms on the loans.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Las Heroinas Group

texts.es:
Ruth America , es Presidenta del Banco Comunal "Las Heroinas", Ruth America, es separada, tiene 56 años D. edad, es jubilada desD. hace 10 años. Empezò el negocio D. venta D. cosmèticos; ya que el pago percibido por su jubilaciòn era muy poco y no era suficiente para sus necesidades bàsicas en su hogar. Para ese entonces aùn tenìa a su cargo a una D. sus menores hijas, quien estaba en edad escolar. 
Al ver que el negocio D. cosmètica era una forma D. encontrase, y tratar D. nuevo con otras personas; ella viò que era un ingreso màs para el hogar, se avocò D. lleno a este negocio; posteriormente la invitaron para ser jefa D. zona. Actualmente venD. y adicionalmente percibe propinas por incrementar mas vendedoras a su grupo. En un futuro cercano la Señora Ruth G. adicionalmente a este negocio, le gustarìa vender productos naturales.
La Señora Ruth America es responsable D. su mamà D. 78 años D. edad, quien està delicada D. salud y necesita D. muchos cuidados; ademas D. una D. sus hijas, quien ya es mayor D. edad, El prèstamo que se le otorga, lo utilizarà para incrementar mercaderìa a su linea D. productos cosmèticos.
(en la foto, la señora Ruth America viste D. pantalon rojo, casaca azul y lleva lentes; es la segunda D. la derecha)

** Las dos fotos pequeñas corresponden a las dos Personas cuyas caras se muestran un poco ocultas.
texts.en:
Ruth America G. S., separated, is 56 years old.  She presides over “Las Heroinas” [The Heroines] communal bank.  She has been retired for ten years.

She started her cosmetics sales business to distract herself and avoid depression caused by the withdrawal from her last job, and because her retirement pay was very little and not enough to proviD. for her household’s basic needs.  

At that time she was still caring for her youngest daughter, who was in school.  She found that a cosmetics business was one way to find herself, and a way of again working with other people.  Ruth saw that it provided more income for her household.  She dedicated herself fully to the business, and afterward she was invited to become boss of the area.

Currently, she sells [cosmetics] and receives tips to add more sales people to her group.  In the near future, Ruth G. would like to, in addition to continuing this business, begin to sell organic products.  

Ruth G. shares her home with her mother and one of her daughters, who is an adult (in the photo, Ruth is dressed in red pants, a blue jacket and is wearing glasses; she is the second from the right].  The loan that she requests will be used to add merchandise to her line of cosmetics products.

**The two small corner photos show the two people whose faces are semi-obscured in the group photo**

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products to boost her sales

loans.name: Perla Del Rosario

texts.es: Perla Del Rosario tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta y repuestos de celulares. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es una persona luchadora emprendedor y disfruta mucho de tener este medio de vida. Inicio con la ayuda de sus padres ya que ella no tenía los suficientes ingresos para establecer este tipo de negocio fue con mucho empeño y sacrificio de parte de sus padres que logro iniciar. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos, carcasas, teclados, pantallas, protectores, baterías entre otros. Pues se acerca una buena temporada y quiere aprovechar al máximo.
texts.en: Perla Del Rosario, 23, has been selling mobile phones and spare parts for over 2 years. She is a hard working entrepreneur and enjoys doing this for a living. She started off thanks to her parents, who, through much effort and many sacrifices, were able to help her, because she didn't have enough income to set up a business. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare parts, cases, keyboards, screens, shields, batteries and other products; she wants to make the most of the good season coming up.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian happily shared that the loan she borrowed from ASHI helps her maintain the growth of her business. Moreover, the income she gets from the business is very helpful in sustaining her family. Additionally, she was able to send her six children to school. Her dream is for her six children to complete college and look for better employment in the future. Because of poverty, there’s nothing to leave her children except a better education. She believes that education is a wealth that others cannot steal. 

Vivian hopes that someday she will be able to expand her direct selling of Avon products and Boardwalk supplies. Therefore, she is now requesting another Kiva loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in order to purchase additional needed stock. She believes that having more items will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood.

Vivian has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2008. She is a dedicated member with regular attendance to weekly center meetings and a solid record of repayment on previous loans. Her long-term goals are to have a winning business and to invest in her home. Additionally, she hopes to maintain her business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family. She says thank you to all Kiva supporters around the world for the chance to reach her goals in life and for giving her the financial funds to pursue her business endeavor. She prays that her lenders will be blessed.

loans.use: To buy additional  Avon products and Boardwalk supplies  to sell

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eliana; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de crianza de cerdo, ella cría pequeños cerdos y luego los hace engordar y crecer y los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Oropesa, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de cerdos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los cerdos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Eliana is 32 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising pigs.  She raises young pigs, fattens them and then sells them in the different markets in Oropesa district.  Through this business she gets her children ahead in life.  Eliana would like to expand her pig business.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Eliana is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma lives in the village of Malinawon, Molave Zamboanga Del Sur. She and her husband have three children. She earns a living as a farm laborer and her husband is a driver. 

Since she became a PMPC member she has a good record that she treasured for a long time which she said that PMPC is the source of their business capital which help for their financial situations. Alma earn much in her livestock to support family needs,and help them financially stable.She request for another loan availment in the amount of 10,000 Php,used for an additional inventory and capital.This loan taken for 6th cycle granted by PMPC.All about PAGLAUM MULTI- PURPOSE COOPERATIVE know as most PROGRESSIVE COOPERATIVE in NORTHWESTERN MINDANAO and REACHES TO POOR COMMUNITIES.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda I. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Yolanda is just starting this business.

In 2011, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Baadiaa

texts.ar: بديعة في عمر 56 سنة متزوجة ولها اربع اولاد تعمل في ميني ماركت لها في عملها نحو 13 سنة تحب عملها وتجيد فن تجديده وتطويره فهي تسعى دائما الى تأمين العيش الجيد لها ولعائلتها فهي طموحة ومحبوبة في محيطها العملي والسكني دائمة التجدد تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وتطوير المحل
texts.en: Baadiaa is 56 years old and married and has four children. She has been working in a mini-market for around 13 years. She loves her work and is serious about developing it as she is constantly seeking to secure a comfortable life for herself and her family. She is ambitious and loved by the people in her local area, both where she works and where she lives. With the loan she wants to buy new inventory and renovate her shop.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory and renovate her shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N., aged 35 years, is married to Richard and they have three children: Fulla, Stephen and Thomas. They live in the Kingstone area. She hawks drinking chocolate and other drinks around Kingstone and its surroundings. She sells her products to different people in different places.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Eastlands office. She has applied for her first loan of KES.12,000 to increase her stock of drinking chocolate for sale.

If the loan boosts her business, she plans to open a grocery shop. Alice describes herself as a focused lady.

loans.use: To increase her stock of drinking chocolate for sale

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En S. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a weaver, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of about USD 1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 80 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a "tuk tuk" (motorcycle taxi) for their child to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a "tuk tuk" (motorcycle taxi)

loans.name: Jimly

texts.en:
Jimly is 37 years old and married with three children.

Jimly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like juices, soap, groceries, etc in her sari-sari store.

Jimly has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from services (ID lamination).

Jimly aspires to repair and renovate her family home and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice T., 36 years old, currently sells fruits and vegetables. Married to a policeman and the mother of four children, all in school, Joice's goal is to buy more goods.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 29 years of age and married with three children. She has a business selling baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Marina needs a loan of 1450 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or about $42 US per week) to improve and expand it. 

Marina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Marina's second loan with SPBD.
