loans.use: to buy ingredients for making baked goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy herbs for herbal medicine business.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Una mujer con mucho optimismo y sueños,  nació en la selva del Perú y desD. muy joven vino a la ciudad, y es ahí donD. conoce a su esposo y tiene un hijo, es presidenta del grupo Mujeres en Acción.
Ella inicio en la venta D. jugos y pasteles en la vía publica, durante muchos años, lamentablemente enfermó y tuvo que dejarlo, nuevamente las ganas y la necesidad D. aportar al hogar  e invertir en los estudios D. su único hijo la motivaron para iniciar su nuevo proyecto: venta D. productos D. belleza: -”yo tengo muchas amigas, me encanta visitarlas, así es que pensé ¿porque no venderles algo que las ayuD.?, así me decidí a iniciar este negocio”……
Además D. su principal negocio,  también venD. gelatinas y pasteles en su domicilio.
Mariela tiene un sueño: tener su bazar-bodega…”allí podría vender también mis jugos y pasteles”
texts.en:
This is an optimistic woman with many dreams who was born in the Peruvian jungle.  At a very young age she came to the city where she met her husband and had a son.  She is the president of the group "Mujeres en Acción".

Many years ago she began as a juice and pastry vendor in the streets but unfortunately fell ill and had to cease her activity.  But the need to help support the family and invest in her son's education encouraged her to begin a new project: selling beauty products.  "I have many friends and love to visit them, so I thought about selling them something that would help them and I set up my business."....

In addition to this business she also sells gelatin and pastry on a door-to-door basis.  Mariela's dream is to open a variety store... "There I can also sell juice and pastry."

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her beauty products business.

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Adjowa est revendeuse  des habits pour enfants. Elle est à son second cycle de crédit et n’a pas eu de difficultés à payer le premier. Elle achète depuis 2005 au marché de Lomé et revend dans les différents marchés. Son mari est chauffeur. Ils ont 03 enfants en charge.
texts.en: Adjowa is 41 years old and sells children's clothing. She is on her second loan and did not have any problems paying back the first one. She has been buying her goods at the market in Lomé since 2005 and resells them in various markets. Her husband is a driver and they have three children in their care.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Dioza

texts.en:
Dioza is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 31 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Dioza is a farmer and grows pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in the local community either by volume or at retail. She has been doing this for three years. Every six months, she earns PHP 40,000 from this farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase plastic mulch and fertilizers.

Dioza has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Dioza hopes to expand her production and to be a good member of the cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase plastic mulch and fertilizers.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudio de 30 años de edad, esta acompañado con la Sra. Lorenza de 26 años de edad, ellos aun no conocen la dicha de tener hijos.
Don Claudio es mecánico hace mas de 11 años, aproximadamente desde el año: 2000; el trabajó mucho tiempo como secretario en un taller mecánico, donde fue aprendiendo este oficio, y a la ves juntando su dinero para poder comprar herramientas y así habilitar para su propio local, en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece.
El tiene como principal objetivo el de construir un tinglado para ofrecerle todas las comodidades a sus clientes.
El invertiria este crédito en comprar más herramientas, teniendo en cuenta que varias personas trabajan para el.
texts.en:
Claudio is 30 years old and lives with 26 year-old Lorenza.  They have yet to experience the joy of having children.

Claudio has been a mechanic for more than 11 years; since approximately 2000.  He worked for a long time as a secretary in a garage where he learned the trade.  He also put together some money so that he could buy tools and set up his own premises.  He currently has a lot of customers thanks to the good service that he provides.

Claudio's main goal is to build a shed so that he can offer his customers all possible comforts.

Claudio will invest this loan in buying tools, bearing in mind that he has several people working for him.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing cars

loans.name: Nemecio Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre trabajador de 70 años de edad. Él esta casado y tiene un hijo a cargo, vive en casa propia en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito La Matanza en Morropón.  Es un hombre de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Manuel se dedica a la producción de frijol de palo, desde hace 15 años. Su gran experiencia ha hecho que Manuel conozca su mercado y que gane clientela fidelizada hacia sus productos. La mayoría de sus clientes son pobladores de su comunidad.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes y hacer labores de deshierbo para sus cultivos de frijol de palo. Además, hará mejoras al interior de su casa que le son de suma necesidad.

Este préstamo le será de gran utilidad y permitirá que Manuel continué con el buen desarrollo de su negocio y mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a hard-working 70 year old man.  He is married and has one child under his care.  He lives in his own house in a small rural community in the La Matanza district in Morropón.  He has good personal and work references.

Manuel has been growing pigeon peas for 15 years.  Through this long experience he knows his market, and he gains loyal customers for his products.  Most of his customers are inhabitants of his community.

He is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and for the work of weeding his pigeon pea crops.  Also, he will make some needed improvements to the interior of his house.  

This loan with be very useful, and it will allow Manuel to continue with the good development of his business and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to weed his crops, and to make some needed improvements to the interior of his house.

loans.name: Mlaa

texts.en:
Mlaa is a single mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables such as maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik is a tailor. She sews in a rented booth in the city market. Knarik would like to enlarge her business by opening one more booth. She needs a new sewing-machine for the future booth. 

With the requested loan Knarik plans to purchase a new sewing-machine. Opening a new booth, Knarik will develop her business and increase her income. This will help her to insure a better future for her family. Knarik lives together with her husband, mother-in-law, father-in-law and son.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing-machine.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a 49-year-old business man. He is married with three children. For the last 17 years, he has been operating a tailoring business and he mainly makes sacks. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business into wholesale. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for making sacks.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sacks.

loans.name: Fanny Maria

texts.es:
Fanny de 48 años es una mujer  trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones de crecimiento  en su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando en su pequeña tienda en donde vende víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc.    

Desea continuar trabajando con ayuda de su hija ya que la tienda le ha ayudado para mejorar su estilo de vida. Tiene aspiraciones de construir mejor su casa ya que la tienda queda en la parte delantera de su casa. Por eso con el préstamo desea comprar cemento, arena para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro desea tener una tienda grande y continuar como cliente en D-MIRO.
texts.en:
Fanny, 48, is a hard-working woman who aspires to expanding her grocery store business where she sells daily consumption items such as rice, canned goods, beverages, etc.

She hopes to continue working with the help of her daughter because the store has helped them improve their lifestyle.  Her goal is to carry out home improvements because the store now occupies the front part of the house.  She plans to use the loan to buy cement and sand for the improvement.  In the future she wants to have a larger store and continue being a D-MIRO customer.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai is 35 years old and married with one child, age two. He runs a pharmacy and drugstore in Aberdeen, Sierra Leone. He also supports three relatives.

Abdulai has owned this business for 11 years. He earns additional income from a commercial bike that he runs for public transportation. He says that the main challenge to his business is unstable electricity. Most of the drugs must be kept in a cool atmosphere, but electricity is not always available. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more blood syrups, malaria drugs, and cold syrups. Abdulai says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open more branches.

loans.use: to buy more malaria drugs and cold medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, snacks, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 39, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Roger, who is self-employed. She is a mother of five children, two are now in high school, one in elementary and two are not yet of school age. She’s doing business while attending to the needs of her family. This is her way of helping her husband with their daily expenses.

Ana owns a variety store selling groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also does some tailoring and repairs as an additional source of income. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community.  She earns 550 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more groceries that will accommodate the demands of her customers. She believes that having more display items will definitely attract more customers which means more profit. She will save her profit for the educational expenses of her children.  

Ana hopes that her variety store will soon become a full-scale grocery. She dreams all her children will be able to finish their studies and strives hard to meet the huge amount of their daily expenses. The weekly fellowship* allows her to understand the value of having time in reading and understanding God’s Word.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and from the village of Capellan, in the province of Isabela. She is engaged in a retail business where sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and coffee. Rosita is a hardworking mother and tries to do everything for her family.

Rosita is asking a loan of P 13,000 to purchase different products like shampoo, soap, toothpaste and snacks to sell for additional income.

In the future, Rosita dreams that someday she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, toothpaste, coffee and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is 32 years old, married and has one child who is eight months old.  He offers services such as printing and photocopying to earn a living for his family.  He has been in the business for five years.  He runs his business in a competitive environment and he is able to retain his customers because of his good customer care.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care skills. 

Rodgers needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer for his business.

loans.name: Jovanis

texts.en: Jovanis is a 47-year-old widow living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a used-clothes business. She has progressed from her starting capital of eight hundred thousand to its current value of two million. She faces the challenges of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her dream is to educate her children. Her business dream is set up a boutique in her town. Jovanis needs the loan to buy women's and children's clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Salote

texts.en:
Salote is 55 years old and married with five children.

Salote owns and operates a business venture selling pancakes. She has two years of experience in this business. Salote needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 240 talas or $100 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Salote joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Salote's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Noemy's Group

texts.es:
Noemy's Group es una sociedad de tres mujeres emprendedoras, en este grupo Noemy es la presidenta ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable en sus actividades. Noemy tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo que es menor de edad, vive en San Gabriel en la provincia del Carchi, que se encuentra en el Norte de Ecuador.

Noemy trabaja con su familia en la crianza de pollos, negocio que le produce muy buenos ingresos económicos que le ayudan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de material para construir galpones, que ayudará a que sus pollos puedan estar mejor y más ampliamente.

El sueño de Noemy es poder tener más sucursales de su negocio ya que no tienen otras fuentes de ingresos que ayuden a satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Noemy's Group  consists of 3 entrepreneurial women.  Noemy is the president of the group, as she is very hard working and responsible in her activities.  She is 49 years old, single, and has a child who is a minor.  She lives in San Gabriel in the Carchi province, located in northern Ecuador. 

Noemy and her family raise chickens, a business that provides very good income and helps her to improve her family's quality of life.  This is her first loan with Fodemi, which she will use to purchase materials to build enclosures for the chickens, which will give them more, better quality space.

Noemy's dream is for her business to have more branches, as this is her only source of income to meet her needs.

loans.use: to build enclosures for her chickens so they have more space.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a 22-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in Buluk, South Sudan, for one year. Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is a 48-year-old woman with three children, two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling breads and cakes. Her husband is a security guard. 

For the past twenty years, Le has run a food stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy rice cakes and many kinds of breads and foods to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy rice cakes and many kinds of breads and foods to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Yesenia Marilu

texts.es: Yesenia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Yesenia quiere mejorar su vivienda quiere repellar y construir una pared que muestra en la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de su venta de tortillas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, ladrillos, hierro, pago de mano de obra, etc. para poder hacer la mejora en su vivienda y asi poder vivir junto con su familia mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 38 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and kids, and makes a living selling tortillas. With the money from her sales, she has been able to pay for the necessities of her household. 

Yesenia wants to better her living situation, but the income she receives is currently not enough to do so. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy cement, bricks, iron, and labor, etc. in order to build a septic tank and a wall. This will allow her and her family to live together more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, labor, etc.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine aged 24 years. She is married with one child who has 3 years. Not yet go to school.  She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Most people in the world dream of getting well-paying jobs. Timothy, from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, has never secured one and has opted to be a smallholder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming.

Timothy is a 26-year-old farmer whose main source of income is milk. He decided to concentrate his efforts in dairy farming since he comes from Kapsowar, where milk is in increasingly high demand due to an upsurge in the population.

Timothy is seeking a loan to buy barbed wire. His dairy cows have been trespassing and eating his neighbors' crops, which has led to massive losses for both his neighbours and him because he was forced to pay for the crops that were destroyed. Through this loan, he will save the money that he previously spent on paying for damages. All that Timothy waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for 12 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 7 farmers in Webuye District. She is 32 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very resourceful person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has a larger farm group support. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 2 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is married with 1 child. After leaving college, she got a small job at Kware, Rongai and from the little savings she made, she bought her own sowing machine and started off her own work. She started her business in 1996. She gets tenders from schools for making uniforms ie dresses, shirts and shorts. The business has grown over the years and she bought other machines to coup up with the increasing demand.

loans.use: : She would like to buy more materials for uniforms and house hold items to easily supply her customers.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Gina operates a drinking shop within the community. She has been in this business for over 6 years. She has participated in the TEACH lending programs of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a Kiva loan amount of $900 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en: Veronique learned how to make jam from a development organisation in Kinshasa. She developed that knowledge and turned it into a business. With the money she raised from the jam business, a total of $300, she expanded her business by adding livestock such as a goat, pig, and some ducks before joining Hope’s Group (a Microfinance Institution in DRCongo) in 2004. From the proceeds from her livestock business, she opened a pharmacy. With Hope’s loans she bought a corn mill. Veronique’s business is developing considerably, and with a loan of $600 she will meet the high customer demand and generate additional profits. She has confronted and overcome many challenges with her business. That’s why she named her business “Long Story.” Veronique, born in 1950, is married and a mother of 10 children.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and goods in bulk.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Q. Suleyman is a young businessman of 18 years old.  He has a small farm consisting of  3 cows.  He wants to enlarge his business, and breed cattle for selling milk.  He has applied for a loan of $900 to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: Going to purchse a dairy cow

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto P. is 35 years old, he is married to Raquel Urunaga who is 25, and they have a little boy who doesn't go to school yet. They live and work together in a place called Jejuí, in the district of Santaní, a city located 320 km from the country's capital.

He as had a carpentry shop for three years. His wife has a secondhand clothing store. He makes all kinds of furniture, such as tables, chairs, and more. He has customers in different cities, such as furniture stores. He needs to buy more wood to fill all the orders he has received in the last months, for which he is requesting a loan of $600 to invest in the purchase of various kinds of wood.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Roberto P. tiene 35 años, el está casado con la Raquel Urunaga que tiene 25 años, ellos tienen un hijo pequeño que aún no va a la escuela. Viven y trabajan juntos en una compañía llamada Jejuí, un distrito de Santaní, ciudad dista unos 320 km. de la capital del país.

Posee una carpintería desde hace tres años, su señora posee una tienda de venta de ropas de segunda mano. El realiza todo tipo de muebles como mesas, sillas, placares entre otros. Posee clientes de diferentes ciudades tanto particulares como mueblerías. Necesita comprar más maderas para poder abastecer todos los pedidos que ha recibido este último mes, por lo que solicita $ 600 para invertir en la compra de maderas de diferentes tipos.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is 43 years old and has three children. She is an artisan as is Elena Pérez López y Maria Luz Hernández Pérez. They make cloth blouses and then embroider them with flowers around the collar. They take the blouses to a nearby town to sell them, and in this way they contribute to the family expenses. They belong to the group called Mujeres para Progresar 1.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DELFINA tiene 43 años, tres hijos. Ella es artesana al igual que doña Elena Pérez López y doña Maria Luz Hernández Pérez. Ambas confeccionan las blusas con tela de manta y posteriormente las bordan con flores alrededor del cuello, lo llevan a vender al pueblo más cercano, de esta forma ellas contribuyen al gasto familiar. Pertenecen al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 1.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is an ambitious woman, she has always found a way to support her home daily and her negotiation skills have placed her and her husband in a partnership. They invested the family savings in a small bus with the purpose of dedicating themselves to public transportation, associating themselves with a local transportation company to cover the route between Sicaya and Huancayo. Fifteen years have passed since they started this project and their hard work throughout that entire time has filled them with satisfaction as they’ve been able to fulfill the needs of their three dear children. Now Angelica would like to start a food selling business because during the past few years their income from the transportation business has decreased and she’s seen the need to create another source of income in order to continue supporting her family. Because the small bus is in urgent need of maintenance for improved daily living, she asks for a loan to cover this service and buy new tires. Lend your support to Angelica and her family, she thanks you for your valuable and important contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica, es una mujer esforzada, siempre ha visto la manera de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y las habilidades de negociación que posee han logrado que ella y su esposo lleguen a un acuerdo de trabajo en equipo e invirtieron los ahorros familiares en la compra de una movilidad con el propósito de dedicarse al transporte público asociándose a una línea local para cubrir la ruta de Sicaya a Huancayo. Ya han transcurrido quince años desde que iniciaron este proyecto y su desempeño durante todo este tiempo los han llenado de mucha satisfacción porque pueden satisfacer las necesidades de sus tres queridos hijos plenamente. Ahora, Angélica, tiene anhelos de implementar un negocio de venta de comidas porque en estos últimos años ha disminuido un poco los ingresos que perciben con su trabajo y a observado la necesidad de crear otro respaldo económico para seguir sosteniendo su familia.La urgente necesidad de otorgarle mantenimiento a su vehículo para un mejor desempeño diario la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para pagar este servicio y adquirir llantas nuevas.Solidarícese con Angélica y su familia, ella te agradece tu valioso e importante aporte.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and pay for maintenance on her only source of income.

loans.name: Agha

texts.en: Agha A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 35 years old, married and has two children. Agha has got a lorry and he earns his family carrying luggage with his lorry. Now he needs a loan in amount $1200 for repairing his lorry.

loans.use: To expand business and repair lorry

loans.name: Gulu C 2001(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Aisha is married with two children. She has a retail shop business. She intends to use the extra busines profits to increase stock in the business and pay school fees for the children. Edith and Flavia both sell charcoal. Yudaya sells raw foods in the market and wans to use the loan to expand her business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Tadd in stock in the retail shop.

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru:
Sharifgul J. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is a 50 year old widow with 6 children. She has high school education. She works in a child care facility as an administrator. She also holds a cattle business. She has a single milk cow, whose milk she uses for her family and for resale. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. Using the credit, she plans to purchase another milk cow and to sell its milk; thus, increasing her overall income. Currently, the prices for cattle are low because of a lack of cattle food. For this reason, this purchase will be profitable for Sharifgul and will also benefit local residents, who will be able to purchase fresh milk at good prices. She will be paying off the load during the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Джалилова Шарифгул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 50 года, вдова , имеет 6 детей.Образование среднее. Работает в детском саду -завхозом. Занимается животноводством. Имеет дойную корову, молоко которой использует для семьи и для реализации. Опыт работы в данной сфере около 6 лет. Планирует получить кредит , для того чтобы купить еще одну корову и получаемое молоко продавать, тем самым увеличив доход. В данный момент цены на КРС упали т.к в феврале у населения обычно кончается корм, поэтому данная покупка может быть выгодна для клиентки, а так же для населения ,которое сможет покупать свежее молоко и по доступным ценам. Погасит кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel M. is a trader who owns a chop bar. He is also a painter. He is married and has two children. He wishes to expand his chop bar business but lacks enough funds.

He is asking for $225 as additional capital to enable him buy more food items for his chop bar business.

loans.use: As additional capitals to enable him buy more food items for his chop bar business.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is the 25-year-old mother of two school-age children who lives in the town of Nyamasaria Kisumu, Kenya. She is also the proprietor of a food kiosk which she opened in 2004. The business is located along the busy Kisumu -Nairobi highway. Every day, she serves over 500 customers and takes in over Kshs 8000 ($129) in revenue. She has applied for a $700 loan to move her business to a larger space to accommodate increased demand from her clients.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To move her business to a larger space.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 32 years old and the mother of two children. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy products like beans, millet and peanuts and then retails them in her town. Frequent travel reduces her income and therefore she wants to use her loan to buy bags of gari, beans, millet and peanuts to avoid price hikes and also to reduce her travels. She is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to support each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari (milled cassava), beans, millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia, José, and Araceli belong to the Los Jazmines Village Bank in San Juan de Lurigancho in Lima.

Julia is married and has 5 children. One of them is completely independent and the 4 others are dependent children finishing college. She works with her husband who is a refrigeration technician. She helps him to contact and coordinate with his clients. They have been working together for 20 years. Her major issue is their economic situation because she is responsible for her children's education.

José and Araceli are a couple; they live together and have a 2-year-old child. José has a moto and uses it as a moto-taxi. He works from Mondays through Saturdays. Araceli has been selling shoes to her neighbours and friends for 2 years now. Her major issue is that her clients sometimes delay paying but she carries on with her job and that’s why she has decided to rent a locale in a shopping arcade where she can sell her shoes.

Julia, José and Araceli are requesting loans of 1200 soles (about US$ 420), 600 soles (about $ 205), and 1000 soles (about $ 350) respectively. Julia wants to help her husband to purchase motors and copper tubes for refrigeration systems for his business. José wants to help Araceli to open her shoe store and Araceli will invest in shoes for re-sale.

loans.use: invest in their micro-entreprises

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru:
Mahsuda P. lives in the Djalloliddini Rumi region. She is 28 years old, married and has 4 children. She is a housewife. She has a milk cow and sells milk on the market. She would like to purchase another cow in order to increase the amount of milk she has for sale. This will allow her to increase the amount of profit obtained from the business and will help better the living conditions of her family. She plans to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Полвонов Махсуда проживает в районе Джаллолиддини Руми. Возраст 28 лет . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Домохозяйка . Имеет корову , молоко которой продает на рынке . Хочет приобрести еще одну корову для того , чтобы увеличить объем получаемого молока. Это даст возможность клиентке увеличить прибыль. Это улучшит условия жизни ее семьи. Для этого планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Saday

texts.en:
Saday N. is 63-year-old man who has been breeding calves in Imishli region since 1980. He is married and has 1 son. He used to work as a doctor, but now he is retired and his main activity is calf breeding. He breeds calves for meat production.

Saday N. has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 USD to purchase 3 calves at an estimated cost of 300 USD each. With the rest of the loan money,he will purchase fodder to speed up the process of the calves growing. This is Saday's second loan. He spent his first loan from AqroInvest purchasing his first calf and he successfully completed that loan.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Afflèhoun

texts.fr: Dame N. Afflèhoun est originaire de Porto Novo la capitale du Bénin. Née il y a 40 ans, elle est mariée au pêcheur HOUNMENOU Atchibaré et est mère de 4 enfants: Jacques, Julien, Jules et Crespin. Très tôt, elle  a commencé le commerce  avec l'aide de sa maman revendeuse de pâte de maïs bouillie. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de poissons fumés et frits. Elle s'approvisionne souvent sur la berge de la lagune de Cotonou non loin de chez elle. Elle souhaiterait augmenter son capital  et renforcer ainsi son activité avec sa clientèle qui au jour le jour s'accroît et manifeste de nouvelles préférences. Dame N. Afflèhoun est à son sixième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afflehoun N. came originally from Porto Novo, the capital of Benin. She is 40 years old, married to a fisherman, Atchibare Hounmenou, and is a mother to four (4) children: Jacques, Julien, Jules and Crespin. Very soon, she will start a new business activity selling boiled corn dough, with the assistance of her mother. She now specializes in the sale of both smoked and fried fish. She often buys her supplies along the banks of the Cotonou lagoon not far from her home. This loan request is intended to increase her funds to support her business and meet the changing needs of her customers. Mrs. Afflehoun N. is making her sixth loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 25 liters of oil and 20 kilograms of fish

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad es casada, tiene  32 años y tres hijos, junto a su esposo trabajan en la chacra.   Siempre le ha gustado trabajar y no depender de su esposo, por ello que además de trabajar en la chacra, ha decidido a comprar árboles y trozarlos y venderlos como leña, de ese modo generar otra fuente de ingreso en su economía. Tiene en mente abrir un negocio de  venta de abarrotes, ya que ahora tiene  su propia casa, porque a ella le agrada estar en contacto con la gente y de paso ir generándose un ingreso extra.  Lo difícil es que en la agricultura, se invierte mucho, pero cuesta muy poco su producto,  por eso es que quiere generar un ingreso adicional.  Soledad trabaja en la chacra ayudando a su esposo, porque a sus  3 menores hijos desea educarlos en la ciudad y sean unos buenos profesionales.  Con el préstamo podrá una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, y de paso incrementar la cantidad de rajados de madera.
texts.en:
Soledad is married, is 32 years old, and has three children. She and her husband work on the farm. She has always liked working, and she is not dependent on her husband. Because of this, in addition to working on the farm, she has decided to buy trees, chop them, and sell them as firewood. In this way, she will have another source of income. She is thinking about opening a grocery store, since she now has her own house, because she likes to be around people and, at the same time, will earn more money. It is difficult that in agriculture, a lot is invested, but the products cost very little. This is the reason that she wants to earn more income. Soledad works on the farm helping her husband, because she wants to educate her three young children and wants them to be professionals. With the loan, she will be able to have a grocery store in her house and, at the same time, increase the quantity of chopped wood she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a grocery store in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice, oil and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of materials to operate an upholsterer's shop.

loans.name: Mercy Anita

texts.en:
Mercy Anita Vasquez I. is 30 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru, a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Mercy is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for three years to support her pastry business. Mercy operates a corner store from her home to support herself. In December and January of this year she would like to sell large pastries know as panetones. Panetones are traditional Peruvian Christmas cakes.

Mercy is requesting a Kiva loan of 1,200 Nuevo Soles to purchase panetones. Families and friends exchange panetones, or literally "big breads" as gifts. They are extremely popular in the season leading up to Christmas and Mercy wants to capitallize on this sales opportunity. She will repay her loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy panetones

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is a 52-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of six kids. Salamatu resides at Abofour with her family. Salamatu lives with her husband in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband, she said, is very supportive in taking care of the kids.

Salamatu is a food vendor who sells "kenkey" in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition, she also sells raw foods such as bags of maize at the market square of Abofour.

Salamatu wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children, especially to pay for their education. Salamatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Fear Not’. She also hope to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita N. works hard to provide for the needs of her family. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Eastern Philippines. She started a business selling rice and other items at a variety store. She is planning to expand the business so that she can cater to the needs of their community. She needs a loan of PHP 8,000. This is her second loan from HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for sale

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kasujja Male Gorreti Group

texts.en:
Rose B. is forty-four years old and she is married with three children. She has a four room house with four people currently staying in it. She also takes care of two orphans who lost their parents. They have three meals a day and her greatest expense is food. 

Rose has a pharmacy and sells medicines to earn a living. She buys her drugs from a pharmacy in the city. Her business attracts about twenty customers a day.  She has been in this business for seven years now. Her greatest challenge is that many of her customers want to buy on credit and don’t want to pay her.

She has worked with MCDT for ten years now and she has worked with the K. M. Gorreti group for two and a half years. She will use this loan to increase her stock. Rose wants to educate her children until they complete their education, and then she would like to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea A. is twenty-one years old and the mother of two children aged six and four. Both children are in school and she hopes she can pay for their education so they can find good jobs. She is a vegetable vendor and wants a loan of $125 to expand her business. She buys her vegetables from Sondu, a small town near Kisii. Lea works and lives in Nyamasaria slum with her husband, a tow-truck driver.

loans.use: Food Stock

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Madame   Assétou   Keita  est âgée de 53 ans,  mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygamique avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle ne commença le commerce qu’après son mariage, en vu d’épauler son mari (bien qu’il occupe un haut poste dans l’administration) dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Elle mena plusieurs activités telles que la vente de condiments et de fruits. Elle opta  finalement pour  le commerce d’habits et de chaussures qu’elle mène depuis 27 ans chez elle ou en ambulant. Nantie d’une grande clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes lettrées, son dynamisme fait d’elle une grande commerçante détaillante de Médine avec ses habits  de hauts  de gammes.
Dans l’optique de satisfaire permanemment sa clientèle elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 500 000FCFA, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  au Burkina Faso. Madame   Assétou   Keita vend, en détail au comptant et à crédit.. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à prendre en charge certaines familiales (achat de savons, charbons et habits des enfants) et de honorer ses dettes. 
Son ambition est de construire des maisons pour usage personnel et location.
texts.en:
Ms. Assétou Keita, age 53, is married and the mother of four. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Médine district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having dropped out of school very early on for societal reasons, she started a business only after her marriage and with the goal of supporting her husband (even though he has a high position in the administration) in meeting family needs. She did several kinds of work, such as selling condiments and fruit. She opted in the end for commerce in clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for 27 years working out of her house or going door-to-door. Bestowed with a large customer base composed mostly of educated women, she has become a great retail merchant in Médine due to her dynamism and her high-end clothing.

From the perspective of satisfying her customers indefinitely, she has turned towards Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 48 months. After four solidarity loans and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA. She intends to use the loan to buy fifty bolts of Wax pagne cloth in Burkina Faso. She makes her sales at the retail level and accepts cash and credit.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover certain family expenses (to buy soap, charcoal, and children's clothing) and to honor her debts. Her ambition is to build houses for personal use and for renting out.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a hog raiser in her village and also sells vegetables. She is 52 years old. Pacita is happily married to Trifilo and has four children, who are all married. She is thankful that her husband is helping her maintain the hog raising business. Since she lacks capital, she would like to borrow 5,000 PHP from the lenders. This loan will be of great assistance in improving her small businesses to help meet their needs.

loans.use: Capital for hog raising and vegetable vending businesses

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en:
Ritha is a poultry keeper and has been running a tailoring business in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for three years. She belongs to the Juhud group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $250. Every day, she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy a sewing machine for her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ritha is 47 years old, married and has four children: ages 25, 23, 21 and 15. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị, age 35, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2003, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for her livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Moauli

texts.en: Moauli M., 35, is married and has four children. She has one year of experience in the baking  business. She sells her products to the public five days a week. This is her first loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (about $158 USD). SPBD loans are Moauli’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use his loan to purchase supplies such as baking powder, flour, sugar, yeast, and cooking oil.

loans.use: Purchase baking powder, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, and cooking oil

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José inicia su Tercer ciclo con 21 socias. Las socias son D. L. comunidad D. YanamilL. que se ubica a L. periferia D. L. ciudad D. ayacucho.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. leña, cereales, abarrotes en general, comida, bebidas, artesanía, tubérculos y brindan servicios D. transporte.

Como es el caso D. Juliana que es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Juliana venD. verduras en L. selva ayacuchana, a donD. viaja semanalmente, y D. L. selva compra frutas que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad. 

Mientras que Vilma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carne, pollo, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. su esposo.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. queso, verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas.

Los sueños D. las socias son techar su casa, tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y ser mayoristas.
texts.en:
The San José Community Bank is beginning in its third loan cycle with 21 members. The members are from the YanamilL. community, located in the outskirts of Ayacucho.

The members have different business such as selling wood, cereals, general groceries, food, drinks, handicrafts, tubers, and offering transportation services.

Such is the case with Juliana, who is 42 years old, has a live-in partner and 4 children. Juliana sells vegetables in Ayacucho’s jungle, where she travels weekly, and in the jungle she purchases fruits that she sells in the wholesale food market in the city.

Vilma is 32 years old, has a live-in partner and 2 children. Vilma has a shop in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, and chicken. She does this with the help of her husband.

The group members need different amounts of loans such as 300 PEN, 600 PEN, 900 PEN, 1000 PEN, making a total of 12.600 PEN in loans at the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, and sodas.

The dreams of the group members are to roof their house, have their own house, have their children become professionals, to improve their business, and to be wholesalers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, and sodas.

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita sells vegetables. She walks from one house to house carrying her basket of vegetables. Sometimes, she also cooks snacks that she sells for additional income. She is 46 years old and married to Villamor, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children, four of whom are still in school. Rebelita hopes that she can continue to send her four children to school so they can finish their studies.  
	
To reach out for her dreams, Rebelita is planning to expand her business by opening a canteen that will be situated in front of the beautiful spot of Sta. Victoria Cave, which is more than an hour's travel from their village. Through the assistance of their Local Government Unit (LGU), and with a loan from Kiva of PHP 6,000.00, she is positive that she can fulfill her plans.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Y

texts.en: Y S. O. is 54-year-old a local farmer living in the rural area of Kampong Chhnang Province, in Cambodia. She has been farming since the early 1980 and is presently earning $2 a day. She is married years ago and has six children; three are married and have ready started new family homes. Two of her children are employed; one is a vender and other one is a tailor, while her husband is 56 years old, a military policeman. Recently, Y S. O. faces difficulty with plowing her own farmland due to the lack of farm supply. This obstacle, she has decided to request a loan of US$500 to add to her personal saving so she affords to buy a cultivating machine which she will use to plow her own farmland and other her neighbor’s farmland for fees.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djantoyerela sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 48 ans et 2  enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Yolla sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés et exercent le petit commerce comme activité économique. Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce prêt servira à acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et de lait frais.
Les condiments sont achetés en gros à Bamako et sont revendus, en détail sur le marché de Fana à une clientèle essentiellement féminine, quant au lait, il est acheté auprès des éleveurs et revendu sur place aux femmes et hommes du village. 
Elles comptent réaliser mensuellement chacune 20.000FCFA de bénéfice. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat de condiments alimentaires et lait.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda C. is from the village of Danao. She is 25 years old. Lyda is engaged and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Lyda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lyda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lyda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Lyda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lyda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is engage in bamboo furniture making business. She is so happy for having the skill to make a furniture using bamboos because she is making income out of it. Aside from this, she is also engaged in hog raising business. She needed additional capital for the improvement of her business to earn bigger income. She hopes to avail a starting loan of at least PHP4,000 to be able to buy more materials to be use in furniture making. She wants to improve and make her business profitable.

	Belen is married to Marcelino who is already 45 years old. He is working in their farm and they help each other in their businesses. They have six children in all. Their eldest and second child are not studying and it is their decision to stop studying. Three of their children are still studying in elementary school and their youngest is just six months old.  The couple is striving hard to be successful in their respective business. They hope that someday they will be able to elevate their ways of living through the businesses that they are managing.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy materials to be use in making furniture

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov K. is married and has two sons. She runs a small retail business that offers a wide range of practical products from tape and screwdrivers to flashlights and electric cords.

Lubov has been in this business for 12 years. For the last couple of years, the business has become a family one. Lubov's husband and children have joined her to help in sales and deliveries. Low prices and a large assortment help them to overcome the competition.

Lubov has requested a loan of 10000 UAH to purchase more inventory for her business. Her business goal is to purchase a kiosk to sell her goods. The kiosk would also serve as storage place.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Espérence

texts.fr: A. Espérence est née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Espérence vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Espérence est mariée à DAHOUNDO Luc, un agent au PTT au Bénin. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Espérence vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Espérence n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Espérence vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs, accompagnée de sucre), et produit également des jus d’ananas qu’elle vend de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Espérence s’approvisionne. Espérence est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir la taille de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Espérence sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Espérence A. was born in 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Espérence has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou for about 20 years. She is married to Luc Dahoundo, an agent at the PTT in Benin. The couple has four children in their care, of which three are their own. All the children are in school and live with their parents. Espérence helps her husband manage the family's expenses. Espérence never went to school. For 10 years, Espérence has sold gruel (made from corn, with sugar added), and she also makes pineapple juice that she sells door-to-door. She gets her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Espérence is a long-time client of Alidé and she has repaid all of her previous loans. She is requesting a third loan through Alidé so she can increase her working capital and increase the size of her business to better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and pineapples

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: K. Aminatou est née en 1956 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Aminatou vit au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, il y a environs 30 ans. Aminatou est mariée à WABI Mounirou et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Aminatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Aminatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, Aminatou s'est mise à vendre divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sucre, lait, sardines, conserves, bougies, papiers hygiéniques, dentifrices, beurre, couscous, etc.), pour faire face à ses besoins. Aminatou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et vend ses produits dans son quartier à Minontchou. Aminatou exerce cette activité depuis environs 25 ans. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Aminatou voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement, ce qui lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est pourquoi, Aminatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aminatou K. was born in 1956 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Aminatou has lived in the district of Minontchou in Cotonou, the commercial capital of Benin, for about 30 years. She is married to Mounirou Wabi and has four children, all in school. Aminatou lives together with her husband and children and helps her husband with the household responsibilities. Having stopped her schooling after high school, Aminatou began selling various products (pasta, sugar, milk, sardines, pickles, candles, toilet paper, toothpaste, butter, couscous, etc.) in order to support herself. Aminatou stocks her merchandise from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sells her products in her neighborhood in Minontchou. She has done this for about 25 years. Aminatou is an old client of ALIDé, having already profited from three loans, which she has completely repaid. Aminatou would like to increase her working capital, which will allow her to better develop her business and better satisfy her clientele. This is why Aminatou is seeking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying foodstuffs and household goods

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch B. is a villager in Royak village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing three more piglets for breeding, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy ten chickens for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Chea Sophoeun, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field of land for cultivating rice. Mrs. Touch B. is 44 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and ten chickens

loans.name: Cony

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, la señora Cony Q. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha iniciado en el mejoramiento de su vivienda por medio de su reconstrucción ya que así lo necesitaba porque dicha vivienda ha estado en malas condiciones.
Ella ha buscado la manera de cómo brindarles a sus tres hijos un techo digno donde habitar y para ello trabaja con el propósito de realizar esta obra. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, piedrín para repellar las paredes y de esta manera contribuir al mejoramiento del nivel de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon, Sra. Cony Quinonez is known for how hard she works. She has just started making improvements to her house which is in such bad condition that it will have to be rebuilt. She wants to provide a decent place for her three children to live and she has worked hard to make it happen. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy construction materials--cement, wall plaster, etc.--that will help her to improve how her children live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nsambya V Mukiibi Madina Group

texts.en: M. Madina is a business, thirty-seven years old, single and blessed with four children of whom three attend school. She also has two dependents attending school. She is a group leader of five group members. M. is deals in the tomato business and she has been selling for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase items such as baskets of tomatoes from far away villages to sell in the market place. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase items such as baskets of tomatoes from far away villages to sell.

loans.name: Obiya East A Laker Barbra Group

texts.en:
L. Barbra is a group representative; she is a twenty-one-year-old businesswoman, married with two children. She takes care of three additional dependents who go to school. 

She has a used clothing business that she has been operating for a period of three years now. She is using the loan to purchase clothes from different places to sell to her customers. She hopes to improve upon her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from different places to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu M. is the proprietor of a store in the central business district of Bo, Sierra Leone. He sells vehicle spare parts and used furniture. He is married and has four dependents. His wife also works for the business. He imports his parts from the U.S and Europe and wants to increase sales of these imports which make him higher profits. He hopes the loan will help him pay his kids' school fees and buy land for future development.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri est composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Bougoufiè de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. 
Le groupe Tièssiri fait le commerce d’articles divers avec les céréales, les habits, des condiments, des cosmétiques, des ustensiles en plastiques, du bois de chauffe, des fruits et légumes, des portes monnaies, de l’encens, etc.
 Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles décidèrent d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les sept précédents.
Ce  nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 4  chargements de camions en bois de chauffe, 2 colis d’ustensiles plastiques, 3 douzaines de porte monnaie, des matières premières pour la préparation d’encens (3kg de n’gueni, 4flacons d’eau de Cologne et de parfums), 10 corbeilles de papayes,  2 sacs de riz et des condiments pour la préparation du riz. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso et  à la foire du grand marché de Ségou et effectuent leurs ventes aux marchés, à domicile et en ambulant, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle diverse et variée.  
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31 600FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer à assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire, les frais de santé et la scolarisation des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is composed of 5 women, all of whom are married and are on average 41 years old with 3 children. They live in traditional extended households in the Bougoufiè area of Ségou (4th Administrative Region of Mali), and know each other through neighbourhood relations. The Tièssiri group sells various items along with cereals, clothing, condiments, cosmetics, plastic utensils, firewood, fruits and vegetables, purses, incense, etc. With the goal of increasing their working capital and diversifying the goods that they sell, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom they are on their 8th solidarity (group) loan, after having properly repaid the seven previous ones. This new loan will be used to buy 4 truckloads of firewood, 2 packages of plastic utensils, 3 dozen purses, raw material for the preparation of incense (3 kg of n'gueni, 4 flasks of eau de cologne, and perfume), 10 baskets of papayas, 2 bags of rice, and condiments for the preparation of rice. They get their supplies in Burkina Faso and at the grand market fair in Ségou, and make their sales at the markets, at home, and door-to-door, in cash at retail and on credit, to a diverse and varied clientele. They intend to realize an average monthly profit of 31,600 FCFA, which will be used to ensure their ability to feed themselves and to pay for the health and education costs of their children. Their long-term goal is to obtain a house that they can use as a home.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina B. is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Narra, Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living from her eatery, and also as an itinerant vendor.

Cristina’s 63-year-old husband, Aram, is a laborer on a sugarcane plantation.  They have six children who are between 17 and 34 years old. Three of them are raising their own families, while the other three work to help their parents.

Cristina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through her eatery and her vending sales. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000 from her business activities.

Cristina is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her eatery and her vending sales. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 23rd cycle loan, PHP 12,000, which she intends to use on her eatery business. Cristina is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for eatery

loans.name: Action Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Janet F. is thirty-five years old. She is married and blessed with five children, most of whom are currently in primary and junior high school. The children are between the ages of five and twenty-two years old. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Janet's husband is a farmer.  She is a very hard-working woman. 

Janet is into trading. She trades in cosmetics such as creams, body lotion, perfumes, powder, etc. She has been in business for fifteen years and aspires to expand her business by procuring goods in bulk. She is also hopeful to give all her children the necessary support they need to make it in life.

Janet is currently the leader of a five-member trust bank group called ‘Action.’ The group members are mainly into food production and trading activities. It is the dream of the members of this group to access this loan so as to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Murehe Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
He has subsisted on a produce-sales business for a timeframe of five years. At the age of 27 years, A. Mariko is a fledgling produce sales business trendsetter whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other youth in his home area of Murehe trading centre, Kihihi. Many youth in his home area preoccupy themselves in self-destructive activities like drinking alcohol and smoking marijuana.

With his hard work, Mariko has managed to take firm root and in a month he apparently makes 200,000 Ugandan shillings. With his monthly savings, he has managed to diversify his small business. This has, however, not come the easy way as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as the unpredictable weather patterns which, for the most part, means he has fewer supplies from farmers.

Mariko’s dream is to build his own produce stalls and stores to keep his surplus goods. With this loan he hopes to implement the idea of building business stalls and stores for his produce.

loans.use: To build stalls and stores for his produce

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita H. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the 15th loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. is from the town of Trento. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also runs a sari-sari store where she sells basic food and daily products. She says she works hard to provide for her family, especially for her children's education.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina pertenece al Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua, es socia hace 15 años y durante este tiempo la ayuda D. Finca fue fundamental para su negocio, aprendió a ahorrar y con sus ahorros pudo educar a sus hijos.
Delfina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, pollo, actividad que realiza todos los días, además junto a su esposo tienen una joyería, productos que venD. en las ferias D. la región. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Delfina es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 estudia y espera que sea un buen profesional.
Delfina sueña con tener una tienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. She has been a member of FINCA for 15 years and the support she received has been crucial to her business. Delfina learned how to save so that her children could have an education.

She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, and chicken. Her business is open every day. In addition, she and her husband have a jewelry shop and sell their products at the regional fairs. Her loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Delfina is married and has three children, one of whom is a student with hopes of becoming a successful professional.

Delfina dreams of having a wholesale store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the town of Banga. She is 60 years old. Merlyn is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale.
