She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm and selling their harvest.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. En un inicio, el negocio agrícola que tenía no le daba buenos réditos, sin embargo y con el tiempo pudo superar tal problema; en la actualidad su producto de cacao es pedido por lo grandes mayoristas debido a la calidad que ofrece, dando como resultado la obtención de ganancias económicas, de esa manera pueda sostener a su familia. Es por ello que trata de estar en su chacra labrando y cuidando sus cultivos de cacao conjuntamente con su esposa, solo que en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que de esa manera puedan facilitarlo en la extracción y selección de su producto agrícola. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es abrir una tienda para así obtener nuevos ingresos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas pactadas, además hace hincapié al buen desempeño que tiene su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para dar  el cuidado adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Julio is 36 years old and married with one son who attends school. The family lives together in the beautiful jungle near Cusco, located at the top of the Peruvian jungle zone. They have their own home there made from adobe. Initially, the agricultural business that Julio had wasn't bringing in enough money. However, after some time he was able to turn things around. Today, the largest wholesalers ask for the cocoa he grows due to the quality he offers, and this has enabled Julio to earn the income he needs to support his family. He runs his small business and cultivates his cocoa crops together with his wife, but during harvest time he needs to hire additional laborers. Julio usually sells his cocoa in the central markets of his community, and his daily routine is to work from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. His future plans include opening his own shop to generate more income. This will be Julio's third loan with MFP, and he commits to continue making his payments on time. He also emphasizes the good work that the communal bank does. With the loan he is requesting, Julio will purchase supplies and fertilizer needed to give his cocoa crops adequate care.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilzer needed to take care of his cocoa crops

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José María es un padre de familia de  42  años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el anexo El Trapiche del caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de granos y menestras. El adquiere estos productos a los agricultores de la zona en donde vive para venderlo en los diversos mercados de la región al por mayor y al menudeo. El negocio cuanta con mucha acogida debido a que este producto es bastante consumido en la región por lo que la demanda siempre está asegurada, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el sostiene la economía se su familia.

José María necesita de capital para ampliar su negocio, actualmente la producción de menestras en la zona ha aumentado ya que es temporada de cosecha y el espera adquirir la mayor cantidad posible para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

José María es un padre responsable y bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder asegurarle a su familia un futuro estable y tranquilo. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
José María is a 42-year-old head of household who lives with his family in Tranca Sasape’s El Trapiche annex, a rural zone of Mórrope district, belonging to Lambayeque province located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He is a grains and vegetables merchant. He acquires these products from area farmers to sell in various regional markets at wholesale and retail. His business is very well received because the products are consumed widely in the region so demand is assured. Income from this activity supports his family. José María needs capital to expand his business. Currently, vegetable production in the area has increased because it’s harvest time and he hopes to acquire the largest amount possible in order to increase sales and profits. To reach this goal he has deemed in advisable to request his first,1800 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. José María is a responsible father who is quite dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman to insure his family a stable and peaceful future. His neighbors and acquaintances in his area consider him to be a tranquil and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells various kinds of cloth at Elmina. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a petty trader and she supports him in providing the basic needs of the family. Ekua has received junior high education.

Ekua’s loan will be used to buy more cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el sector Cruce de Vega del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de árboles frutales como mango y limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría ovejas y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Su esposo trabaja en la localidad de Paita a mas de una hora y media del lugar donde vive, con lo que ambos ganan se encargan de solventar los gastos familiares.

Genoveva desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas alimento para mejorar el desarrollo de sus animales, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Genoveva es una mujer tranquila y bastante entregada a su familia, las personas que le conocen le estiman mucho y le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 39 years old, she is married and she lives together with her family in the Cruce de Vega sector of the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural region dedicated primarily to the cultivation of fruit trees such as mango and lemons. It is located in the province and region of Piura. It is located more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. She raises small farm animals, such as sheep and poultry, including turkeys and chickens. The backyard of her house is where she keeps her livestock. She feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they have reached a certain level in their development she sells them to the merchants that visit the region. With what she and her husband earn they are able to cover the family's expenses. Genoveva wishes to expand her business and wishes to purchase feed to help her livestock grow. In order to reach her goal she has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. Genoveva is a very calm person who is very devoted to her family. Those that know her appreciate her and they consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. He has driven a taxi since 2005. His main route is between his village and its surroundings. He works hard to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to replace the van engine. He says that he will be able to attract new customers after making this repair. His income from his taxi business is vital for supporting his family. In the future, he hopes to purchase a new car so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To replace the van engine

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama La Capilla, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Anenecuilco, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 12 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinos, los integrantes del grupo son la señora Raquel C. R. va a comprar con su crédito blusas, pantalones, camisas etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora Antonia Gutiérrez Martínez va a comprar todo tipo de frutas y verduras para surtirse, el señor José Luis P. C. va a comprar ropa por mayoreo para vender, la señora Porfiria R. González va a comprar perfumes para vender por catalogo, la señora Araceli P. C. va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo par vender, la señora Ángela P. F. va a comprar sartenes, planchas, burros de planchar etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora Reyna C. Vélez va a comprar Tela, Hilos etc. para su taller de costura, el señor Miguel C. P. va a comprar sartenes, vaporeras etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora Teresa F. E. va a comprar todo tipo de verduras para vender, el señor Guadalupe A. F. va a comprar aceites, refacciones para arreglar los carros el es mecánico, la señora Petra F. H. va a comprar todo tipo de dulces para vender, la señora Silvia Gutiérrez Sánchez va a comprar perfumes, desodorantes, cremas para su venta por catalogo. La señora Porfiria R. González es integrante del grupo La Capilla, ella tiene 69 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º año de primaria ella tiene 7 hijos ellos son María tiene 49 años de edad, Santiago tiene 47 años de edad, Ángel tiene 45 años de edad, Juan tiene 43 años de edad, Agripino tiene 38 años de edad, Rosa tiene 36 años de edad y Julia tiene 33 años de edad, sus hijos son casados menos Santiago es soltero y vive con su mama la señora Porfiria, ella solicito su préstamo para pagar su pedido de Fuller y quiere aplanar su casas el piso de adentro, ella vender perfumes Estrella y cosméticos por catalogo de Fuller, sus clientes son las señoras, las muchachas y los señores, ofrece a sus clientes perfumes, lápiz labial, crema, maquillaje, ella inicio la venta por catalogo hace 10 años la señorita Adrian la invito es la promotora se le dificulto al principio pero poco a poco aprendió se compro una calculadora para y ya se le hace más fácil aprendió a cobra y ahora tiene la costumbre de vender y ya no lo puede dejar. Le dan crédito de 15 días para pagar, sale por la mañana a ofrecer sus productos, reparte sus pedidos, les cobra a sus clientes y mete sus pedidos. La señora Porfiria considera importante su negocio porque le ayuda tiene dinero y le gusta vender, por que trabaja y se distrae, le proporción gran satisfacción y alegría cuando le pagan y tiene dinero, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para comer, para pagar el agua, la luz. Ella está con gusto contenta con el préstamo que le proporciona por que le van a dar dinero. Las mejorías que desea para sus hijos es que estén bien ya que cada quien tiene su vida aparte. Los integrantes del grupo la Capilla quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con los préstamo ya que nos están echando la mano para crecer, gracias”. La señora Porfiria le gusta Anenecuilco porque está viviendo bien, aquí compro un pedazo y aquí vive, en Anenecuilco está el museo de la casa de Emiliano Zapata donde pasan una película de la historia y piezas que utilizaba, fotos el día 8 de agosto celebran el nacimiento de Emiliano Zapata con veladas donde hay ballet de bailables regionales, bandas de viento y personas que les gusta cantar.
texts.en:
This group is called La Capilla and is located in the community of Anenecuilco, Ayala in the state of Morelos in Mexico. The group is made up of 12 members that know each other well and are neighbors.

Mrs. Rachel C. R. is going to buy blouses, pants, shirts etc. with the loan. To better stock her business, Antonia Gutiérrez Martínez is going to buy all types of fruits and vegetables. José Luis P. C. will buy clothing wholesale to sell while Porfiria R. González will buy perfumes to sell by catalog. Araceli P. C. will buy shoes wholesale to sell and Ángela P. F. will buy pans, irons, and ironing boards, etc.. To stock her store Reyna C. Vélez will buy fabric, thread, and other items. Miguel C. P. will buy pans, steamers, and other cooking items. To stock her store Teresa F. E. is going to buy different types of vegetables. Guadalupe A. F. is going to buy oil and mechanical parts to fix cars with. Petra F. H. is going to buy all types of sweets to sell while Silvia Gutiérrez Sánchez is going to buy perfumes, deodorants, and lotions to sell by catalog.

Porfiria R. González is a member of La Capilla group who is 69 years old and only studied up to the 2nd year of primary school. She has seven children: Maria, 49 years old, Santiago, 47, Ángel, 45, Juan, 43, Agripino, 38, Rosa, 36, and Julia, 33. All of her children are married except for Santiago who is single and lives with Porfiria. She is asking for a loan to pay for her orders to Fuller (a catalog). She also wants to improve the floor of her apartment and sell Estrella perfumes and cosmetics from the Fuller catalog. Her clients are women, girls, and men and she sells perfume, lipstick, lotion, and makeup. She has been selling from the catalog for 10 years when Adrian first invited her to sell them. It was difficult at first but little by little she learned, bought a calculator to help her make change, and now she is in the habit of selling and cannot stop. She gives her clients 15 days of credit. She leaves in the morning to sell her products, distribute her orders, charge her clients, and put in new orders. Porfiria considers her work important because it helps with her finances and she enjoys selling the products since she gets to wander while she works. She receives great satisfaction and joy when she gets paid and has money. She uses the income from her business to buy food, pay for water and lights. She is very happy to be receiving this loan. She wants her children to be happy and continue living independently.

The members of the La Capilla group would like to say to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "thank you for supporting us with this loan and lending us a hand to grow, thank you."

Porfiria likes Anenecuilco because she lives well there. She was able to buy a piece of land and live there. In the city of Anenecuilco is the museum of the house of Emiliano Zapata where parts of a historical movie were shot and they used photos from the celebration on the 8th of August which celebrates the museum of Emiliano Zapata with regional dancing, brass bands, and singers.

loans.use:
To buy Fuller perfumes and cosmetics, lipstick, lotions, and makeup.

va a comprar perfumes y cosmetitos de Fuller, perfumes, lapiz labial, cremas, maquillajes

loans.name: Loeb's Group

texts.en:
Ten people are coming together for this village loan. They are located in Vihear village in Kandal province. The village members selected Mrs. Loeb C., 39 years old, as the village bank president. Each member of the group will each use his or her portion of the loan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support his or her different purpose. 

Mrs. Loeb C. is a farmer who owns a plot of rice field to cultivate rice for a living. To support this farm, she would like to use a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. The rest of the loan she would like to use to repair her chicken house. Her husband, Mr. Soem Chann, 42, works as motorbike taxi driver.
They have three children who are students in the local school and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Erasmina Mercedes

texts.es:
Erasmina F. de 55 años y residente en el barrio Simón Bolívar en la ciudad de Barranquilla, es una confeccionista que vive con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 33 y 34 años. Ella inició su negocio hace treinta años confeccionando sus propios uniformes;  empíricamente cosía a su familia porque miraba como lo hacia su vecina,   posteriormente cuando  fue a trabajar en una fábrica de confecciones, perfeccionó su arte, que hasta ese momento era totalmente producto de su potencial artesanal. Así fue como inició su negocio  en  el municipio de Santo Tomás,  donde vivía y luego cuando se mudó a Barranquilla, retomó su trabajo y empezó a recomendarse ella misma con su propio oficio,  hasta llegar a incrementar su clientela, que ahora la conforman no solo  personas del barrio donde tiene el negocio, sino también de su natal Santo Tomás. Con esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y generar ingresos importantes para el hogar; este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con los anteriores logró aumentar su capital de trabajo, porque era muy pequeñito, ahora se siente mas holgada para comprar de contado y responderle a sus clientes de una manera oportuna. Con su credikiva se surtirá de telas, adornos e hilos, para mostrarle a sus clientes y para que ellos escojan la tela que quieren lucir en sus nuevos vestidos que lucirán   los días:  7 de Diciembre, día la inmaculada concepción, cuando todos madrugan a poner velas y faroles en los bordes de sus casas, 24 de Diciembre, celebración del nacimiento del niño Jesús y 31 de Diciembre, final del año de gran despedida popular con fiestas, donde se intercambian  abrazos y se da la bienvenida al nuevo año a  familiares y entre los vecinos del barrio, entre pitos y matracas, música y sonrisas.
Su sueño es continuar creciendo para mejorar sus ingresos familiares y poder ayudar a todos sus hijos siempre y a su familia en general. Su mayor desafío es el exceso de trabajo que tiene por la gran clientela que muy satisfechas con sus costuras, la buscan; entonces en temporadas como las de Diciembre, su tiempo es insuficiente para responderle a todos y poderlos conservar durante todo el año; pero finalmente cuando estas temporadas llegan, cuenta con ayudantes y colaboradores que también ganan su dinerito extra y así ella puede cumplir con su apoyo.
texts.en:
Esramina F. is fifty-five and lives in the Simón Bolívar neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla.  She is a seamstress and lives with her partner.  She has two children, thirty-three, and thirty-four. She started her business thirty years ago, sewing her own uniforms.  She got experience sewing for her family because she saw how her neighbor did it.  Later, when she went to work in a sewing factory she perfected her art, which until then had been only the product of her potential as an artisan.  That was how she started her business in the town of Santo Tomás, where she lived.  Then, when she moved to Barranquilla, she picked up with her work again and started to market her own services to the point that she grew her clientele, who now comprise not only people from her area, but also from her native San Tomás.

Through her business, Esramina has succeeded in getting her family ahead and making significant income for the household.  This will be her sixth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She was able to use prior loan to increase her working capital, because she didn't have much.  Now she feels better able to buy in cash and respond to her clients in a timely fashion.

With her Kiva loan, Esramina will stock up on fabrics, ornaments, and thread to show her clients so they can choose the fabrics they want for the new clothes they will sport on special days:  December 7th, the Day of the Immaculate Conception, when everybody gets up early to line their properties with candles and lamps; December 24th, celebrating the birth of the baby Jesus; and December 31st, the last day of the year, marked by big send-offs, with fiestas where everyone exchanges hugs and welcomes the new year with their neighbors and families with whistles, noisemakers, music, and smiles.

Esramina's dream is to keep growing so she can increase her family's income and always be able to help all of her children and her family in general.  Her biggest challenge is the excess of work she has for all the clientele that are happy with her garments and seek her out.  In seasons like December she doesn't have enough time to respond to everyone and retain them throughout the year. But when the season finally does come, she has helpers that also earn a bit of extra money, so she can get it done with their support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, adornments, and thread to sew garments.

loans.name: Krem

texts.en:
Krem T. has been in the farming business for years in Kompong Tom Province. She plants various crops to earn a living.  She typically generates an income of $1.20 per day. 

Her husband earns a living selling rattan beds in front of their house. He sells rattan that he produces by himself or that he orders from other producers who live in the village. He can earn on average a profit of $5.20 a day to share responsibility with Krem T. for the family’s need.  Krem T.’s husband runs his business well from day to day because he has good communication skills with his customers. 

This couple has been married for years. They have a child who is studying in school. Krem T. sees that her husband’s business is profitable and she would like to borrow some funds for her husband from Kiva to buy more wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy wood to make beds to sell

loans.name: Munh-Yurtunts

texts.en:
Munh-Yurtunts is 34 year old and lives with her daughter in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her two sons live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in her sister's fence. Her daughter attends a local secondary school. Munh-Yurtunts operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local trade center. She started her business in 2002 and has since gained a significant experience as a businesswoman. 

She received the loan from Xac Bank previously and had proven himself as a trustworthy customer. She needs more funds in order to expand her work place and increase her product line. In the future, she hopes to continue her success and grow her business. She says, "All I want is to educate my daughter and help her to become a successful business person in the future" She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Maïmouna Bah

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna Bah D. est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mère d’une fille et elle vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux dans le quartier Millionking de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Madame Maïmouna Bah D. est titulaire d’un C.A.P. (Certificat d’Aptitude Professionnel) et dans le souci de s’intégrer dans le tissus économique et subvenir à ses besoins, décida de s’initier au commerce notamment à l’achat vente des produits d’alimentation. Avec des années d’expérience, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Fana. Elle vient de commencer avec l’institution et est à son premier individuel.
Elle se propose de payer avec ce prêt: des paquets de biscuits, des sacs de sucre, des cartons de l’eau potable, des confitures et des casiers de boissons sucrerie à Bamako. Elle revend, en détail, au comptant dans sa boutique sise aux abords de l’artère principale qui relie Bamako à Ségou et qui d’un accès très facile, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs Maïmouna Bah Diarro is 27 years old and the mother of a daughter. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the neighborhood of Millionking in the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. Mrs Maïmouna Bah Diarro holds a degree of a vocational training school. Her wish to become integrated into the economic life and provide for her needs led her to learn trade skills, in particular running a grocery store. After several years of experience her business is in high demand and appreciated in Fana. She recently joined our institution and this is her first individual loan.

She intends to use her loan to buy packages of cookies, sacks of sugar, boxes of drinking water, jam and racks of sweetened drinks in Bamako. She retails the goods for cash in her easily accessible store located on the main road from Bamako to Ségou to a clientele made up of women and men.

She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay the installments of the loan as well as health services, food and school fees. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Rosamar

texts.en:
Rosamar G. is a farmer. She grows rice in the small town of Banga, South Cotabato. All her life, she has been a farmer. She is happy that until now, she has been able to provide for the needs of her family.

With 4 years experience, she has been successful. But since most of her profit goes to family expenses, she needs this loan to help her get ahead in her business. She plans to have a bigger farm someday. 

At 26, she is determined to continue her business, since it provides for her family's basic needs.
 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to fund her farm

loans.name: Peter Matheka

texts.en:
Peter Matheka K., 35 years old, is married to Wambua, who is a house wife. They have four school-going children. He sells clothes at the rural market within Emali town, where he goes during market days.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client of KADET, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He plans to buy one bale of clothes for resale. The additional income will be invested back into the business.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business, educate his children and eventually to buy a pick up. He is a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy a bale of clothes to add onto his inventory for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a natural juice drinks selling business for the past six years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a clothes selling business which is another source of income. Francisca faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her businesses and maintain her customers in the future.

With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase a refrigerator, fruits for making juice and Kikoi’s (traditional cotton waist/shoulder wraps) to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, fruits for making juice and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Nathali

texts.es: Veronica Nathali R. D. M., D. veinticinco años D. edad, resiD. en Talnique, departamento D. La Libertad, vive en compañía D. su esposo y su pequeña hija D. 4 años, Susana. Veronica ha instalado en su misma casa una tienda en la que provee a sus vecinos D. productos como: Detergentes, Huevos, Gaseosas, Enlatados.  Vale la pena mencionar que este negocio ha sido herencia que su madre le dejo, quien por cierto logró instalarse hace mas D. 10 años gracias al apoyo D. los créditos que INTEGRAL dio. Ahora Veronica desea que el negocio que su madré le encargó crezca y esta luchando incansablemente para lograrlo y tiene plena seguridad que con un crédito bien invertido lo logrará
texts.en:
Veronica Nathali R. D. M. is 25 years old and lives in Talnique, in the department of La Libertad, with her husband and 4 year old daughter Susana.  

Veronica has set up a store in her house that provides her neighbors with products like detergents, eggs, soda, and canned goods.  It is worth mentioning that she inherited this business from her mother, who succeeded in starting the store more than 10 years ago thanks to loans from Integral.  Veronica hopes that the business her mother left in her care will grow and she is tirelessly working to achieve her goal.  She is confident that a well invested loan will achieve success.

loans.use: to purchase meat, cold cuts, drinks, and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Emelita's Group

texts.en:
Emelita B. is from the village of San Luis, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Emelita is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emelita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Emelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her pump boat.

Susan has been in this business for a year and earns an additional income from her tricycle transport business.

In the future, Susan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her pumpboat

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert S. is 57 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Bulbulistsikhe, Khashuri district. Agriculture is the only source of income for Albert and Marina (his wife). They have two milk cows and one bull. Milk is used to make cheese, which is sold on the local market. Also the family owns one hectare of land where haricot, maize, cucumbers, tomatoes and onions are grown. The vegetables are sold locally. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Albert has a truck that he uses for transporting agricultural products and materials. This truck is an additional source of income for the family. 

With the requested loan, Albert plans to purchase a mini (hand) tractor. In the future, Albert won’t hire a tractor for tilling his plot. It will significantly reduce his expenses for tilling. Also, Albert will rent his tractor to neighbor farmers and get extra income. 

Albert and Marina plan to reinvest their profit in dairy farm development. Also they want to renovate their house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeurn S. is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Punlork Pol is 36 years old.  They live in a village along National Road Number one, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have three children: one son and two daughters, who all attend school. 

Sokhoeurn and her husband are farmers. In addition, Mr. Punlork Pol is also a barber. Sokhoeurn is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. 

Photo: Mrs. Sokhoeurn S. and her husband are pictured at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: O. Adèle

texts.fr: Adèle est née en 1979 à Pobè dans le département de l’Ouémé et est mariée à un agent de pharmacie nommée Edouard. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Adèle et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Adèle et son mari. Adèle a très tôt abandonné l’école au profit de la couture qu’elle a appris et qu’elle exerce depuis une dizaine d’année. De façon secondaire, Adèle vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Adèle s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Adèle désire mieux équiper son salon de couture par l’achat d’autres matériels de couture performants. Pour ce faire, Adèle sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Adèle was born in 1979 in Pobè in Ouémé Department. She is married to Édouard, a pharmacy employee. They have two children, who attend school. Adèle and her husband live together with their children. The parents share household expenses. Adèle left school very early to work as a seamstress. She learnt the craft and has been working for ten years as a seamstress. As a second activity, Adèle sells sewing supplies in her workshop. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In order to better meet the demand of her customers, she decided to improve her sewing workshop and buy high-performing sewing equipment. Therefore, Adèle and her group came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a second loan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidering machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Aleyda Matilde

texts.es: Aleyda Matilde se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de billar y fritanga. Tiene más de 10 años a su cargo, es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de actividad económica. Ella tiene muchos clientes que llegan a buscar en su negocio un poco de diversión se siente pues ellos la conocen y saben que brinda un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de tacos, pelotas, mesas de billar entre otros productos.
texts.en: Aleyda Matilde's business is providing pool services and also fried food.  She has been in the business for more than ten years and she is a very responsible person who enjoys her work.  Aleyda has many customers who come to her business looking for a little entertainment.  They know her and they know that she provides a good service.  She is requesting this loan to buy pool cues, balls and tables, amongst other products.

loans.use: to buy pool cues, balls and tables, and other products

loans.name: Deidamia

texts.es:
Deidamia tiene 52 años de edad, ella vive con su padre e hija que es menor de edad, actualmente reside en casa de su padre  la cual está ubicada en un comunidad urbana, pequeña llamada Pacanga en el departamneto de La Libertad.

Deidamia  se dedica la venta de golosinas y gaseosas en el exterior de un  colegio desde hace más de 3 años en los cuales ha adquirido experiencia en el negocio.  Adicionalmente Deidamia se dedica a dar pensión cerca a una comisaria,allí da pensiona muchos policías, quienes le han sugerido que amplíe su  local ,para que pueda cubrir la demanda de su negocio.

 Deidamia está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar sillas mesas y otros muebles que le hacen falta para complementar su negocio.

Deidamia es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  tranquila y amable.
texts.en:
Deidamia is 52 years of age and lives with her father and minor daughter. Currently she lives in her father's home which is located in a small urban community called Pacanga in the department of La Libertad. 

Deidamia sells sweets and soft drinks outside a high school which she has done for over three years, gaining experience in her business. Additionally Deidamia provides pre-ordered meals to regular customers at a spot near a police station. There she provides meals for many officers, who have suggested that she expand her premises in order to meet the demand for her business. 

Deimadia is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 Peruvian soles in order to buy chairs, tables and other furniture she needs to further outfit her business. 

Deidamia is a very hardworking and dedicated woman who makes the effort to get ahead every day and have a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be an easygoing and friendly person.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for use in her business.

loans.name: Crystal

texts.en:
Crystal founded Detroit Brunch in November 2010 after noticing a growing demand amongst friends for quality vegan foods during her Sunday brunches. An entrepreneur at heart, Crystal saw an opportunity to start her business in order to create a vegan space for community members, embody sustainable business practices, and educate members of the Detroit community about the food system and benefits of healthy and locally grown foods. 

Today, Detroit Brunch organizes a brunch one Sunday per month with food from local farmers purchased at Detroit’s Eastern Market, while Crystal continues to work at a Deli.  Individuals place brunch orders online and pick up the food from a public spot in downtown Detroit.  Crystal is energized by the support of her local community, with volunteers stepping forward to assist with development of marketing materials and other areas of her business. 

Crystal hopes one day to expand Detroit Brunch through either a food truck or commercial kitchen in Detroit.  With this loan from ACCION USA, Crystal will participate in a Fast-Trac business planning and one-on-one counseling program with Detroit’s Tech Town, fulfilling her desire to enhance community connections and refine her market strategy. 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps and ACCION USA.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit.

loans.use: to participate in a business development and networking course.

loans.name: Maria Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Liz vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Ella es comerciante hace más de tres años, la misma tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que le costó bastante obtener su propio negocio ya que había viajado al exterior para hacerse un poco de capital porque el sustento del día a día es muy pesado, mas aun teniendo un hijo a quien criar. Ella es soltera con un Hijo llamado Ale de 5 años, y es el motivo por el cual su lucha se hace más liviana.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás para el abastecimiento de su local, sabe que si tiene mayor variedad de productos, podrá atraer a mas clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda que le brida.
texts.en:
Maria Liz lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo.  She has been a saleswoman for three years and has a well-stocked grocery store.  She comments that it cost her quite a bit to obtain her own business.  She traveled abroad to make a little capital because supporting yourself day by day is very hard, even more so when you have a child to support.

Maria Liz is single and has a 5 year-old son called Ale who makes all her hard work feel that bit lighter.  She is requesting a loan to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, etc. to stock her store.  She knows that if she has a larger variety of products, she will be able to attract more customers.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help that they give her.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food products and dairy products to stock her store

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maruja;  tiene 38 años de edad  y es conviviente la socia tiene 2 hijos de 13, 11 años de edad; se dedica  a la administarcion y atencion de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende todo lo referente a mercaderia de primera necesidad los productos que salen a diario y los productos que son para uso externo tambien, La socia desea implemetar su tienda con mas productos de primera necesidad, ella comprara arroz, aceite, fideos, azucar, harinas, lecehe en cajas, mazamorras, gelatinas y mucho mas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maruja is a member of the Communal Bank “Illary III” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 13 and 11). Maruja manages and attends to a grocery store where she sells all types of everyday basic necessities and products for external use. She wants to keep her store in operation by restocking with more basic necessities such as rice, oil, noodles, sugar, flour, cases of milk, mazamorra (corn pudding), gelatin, and other items. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in these basic necessity products.

Maruja appreciates and values the loan that has been provided so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessity products for restocking her store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lourdes; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 2 hijos de 4,6 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la carpintería, ella ayuda a su conyugue en los oficios simples dentro de su taller de carpintería, la socia da los acabados, ve las contratas, las entregas, los pagos y también colabora con los últimos detalles de los diferentes muebles y trabajos pequeños simples por realizarse, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera para apoyar en la carpintería y traer más beneficio monetario, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor en medidas de pies. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

Lourdes, the member, is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years of age.  She is in carpentry.  She helps her spouse with simple tasks in his carpentry shop.  She does the finishing touches, sees to contracts, deliveries and payments and also collaborates with final details of the furniture and small jobs to be done to support the carpentry shop and produce more monetary benefits.  She is asking for the loan to buy lumber.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to pay her installments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is a rice farmer and is engaged. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years, having learned rice farming through a formal training program. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor coasts during rice production.

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.ru: Elsevar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Elsevar rodilsya v 1974 qodu. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: Elsevar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  He is married and has two children.  Elsevar was born in 1974.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle to develop his business.  He learned this business from his father, who is also involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Martir Noel

texts.es:
Mártir, vive junto con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica a vender ropa: para niños, damas y caballeros, y lo hace todos los días ya que el fin de semana (domingo) es cuando se vende más y por eso necesita tener variedad para ofrecerles a los clientes.
El préstamo lo necesita para incrementar más su negocio y mejorar su inventario, ya que el mercado donde vende es muy competitivo, el cual le permitirá mejorar económicamente, su compra será en camisas, short para niños, ropa interior y blusas.
El sueño de Mártir crecer en el negocio, y con las ganancias que obtenga comprar un lote para hacer su casa propia y darle una mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mártir lives with his wife and daughter. He sells clothing for children, women, and men. He does this every day because the weekend (Sunday) is when he sells more. He needs a good variety to offer to his customers.

He needs the loan to expand his business and improve his inventory. The market where he sells is very competitive. Expanding his business will allow him to improve his economic situation. He will buy shirts, shorts for children, underwear, and blouses.

Mártir’s dream is to grow his business. With the income he will earn, he will buy a piece of land to build his own house so he can provide better stability for his family.

loans.use: to by shirts, shorts for children, underwear, and blouses.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, tiene la edad 39 de años, está casada y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo actualmente. Ella con el crédito va comprar cosméticos y ropa para la venta. Ella cuenta con un pequeño local donde vende ropa y productos para belleza. Ella quiere aumentar la cantidad de productos para su venta y así tener una mejor diversidad de productos para su venta y aumentar la clientela de compra de productos. Ella tiene como meta generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y propio en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
At present Liliana is 39 years old, married, and lives with her two children and husband. With the loan she will buy cosmetics and clothing to sell. She has a small business where she sells clothing and beauty products. 

She wants to increase the number of products for sale to have a greater diversity of items, and grow her clientele. Liliana's goal is to generate a larger profit for the well-being of her family and herself for the future. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hadn't had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with more ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Ángel es un hombre muy trabajador que hace 14 años inicio con su negocio de venta de ropa usada solo los fines de semana El local se ubica en un buen lugar ya que esta en frente de una tienda muy conocida en la ciudad, aparte de que hay otros vendedores el es conocido por traer variedad de ropa y mayor calidad.
Los clientes en este momento le están encargando ropa de temporada, botas, zapatos, pero en este momento no tiene el suficiente dinero para ir a comprar la mercancía ya que donde la compra es de  EUA donde vende la ropa por pacas, pero el traslado le cuesta es por ellos que recurre a esta institución para adquirir un préstamo para invertirle al negocio y así tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel is a very hardworking man who started his used clothing business, which he runs on weekends, 14 years ago. His business is in a good location because it is in front of a well-known store in the city. Even though there are other vendors, he is known for offering a variety of high-quality clothing.

At this time, his customers are ordering seasonal apparel, boots, and shoes, but he currently does not have enough money to go and purchase the merchandise since he obtains it from the USA, where clothing is sold by the bundle. Transporting the merchandise is quite costly, which is why he turns to this institute to obtain a loan that he will invest in his business, thus boosting sales.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal apparel, boots, and shoes.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 46 years old and is married with 6 children. With 4 children in school, Zita works very hard to provide for them.

Zita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Zita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Zita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Khursheedan's Group

texts.en:
Khursheedan is 46 years old and spends most of her time staying at home and fulfilling her household responsibilities. 
Her husband is a salesman and sells edible items (candies, snacks, etc.) to different shops. He is very hardworking person and works for long hours to earn money for his family.
Khursheedan has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy foods in larger quantities that will allow him to fulfill his customers' demands and increase his profits and sales.
He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Khursheedan is confident that an investment will help her husband make positive changes to his business and increase his profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheedan.

loans.use: to buy edible items (candies, snacks, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 40 years old and married to Wairimu; they have six children. Besides farming as his primary activity, he also operates a retail shop in the area.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients, and this will be his first loan to buy salt, wheat flour, tea leaves and washing detergent for sale. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, David hopes to expand his retail shop to a wholesale one, make more profits and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy salt, wheat flour, tea leaves and washing detergent.

loans.name: Joefrey

texts.en:
This is Joefrey, 43, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Loleta, a housewife and mother to their four children. He, along with his wife and children, manages their household while operating the business. He works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses and to support his children’s schooling.

Joefrey operates a food stall where he sells fish balls. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold on street sides; they are served skewered and can be dipped in different kinds of sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flattened in shape and often made with cuttlefish meat. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more quantities of fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands the business.

Joefrey hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fish ball products and other ingredients

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. For the past six years, Resty has been working hard to manage her restaurant and bar, which prepares hot meals for customers and offers beer and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients for food and more crates of beer and soda. This will help Resty to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another bar. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Resty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food and more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda de 37 años, esta casado con Alberto de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 04 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Yolanda, es consecuente con sus ideas, trabajadora y muy creativa, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras. Incursionó en éste negocio gracias al impulso de sus vecinos quienes la incentivaron a formar parte de la junta de vecinos que tienen su puesto en el mercado de su ciudad. Entonces accedió a un puesto donde ahora expende frutas y verduras. Generalmente trabaja sola pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo y esposo. Yolanda está feliz y agradecida con sus vecinos por lo que gracias a ello viene obteniendo buenas ganancias así podrá cubrir algunas necesidades primordiales en la familia, cosa que antes el dinero que percibía su esposo no era tan suficiente razón por la que ella decidió realizar este negocio. 
Yolanda en un futuro piensa en mejorar su establecimiento y tener mas mercadería. Este será su primer credito por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará más mercaderías entre frutas y verduras.
texts.en: Yolanda is 37 and married to Alberto, 40. Their marriage produced 4 children. They live together in their own house located in the Pichari district. Yolanda is very principled person, hardworking and creative. She has a fruit and vegetable stand. She started this business thanks to the encouragement of some neighbors, who incentivized her to become a part of their group that has stalls in their local market. Then she got a post where now she sells her fruits and vegetables. She usually works alone but sometimes receives help from her son and husband. Yolanda is happy and thankful for her neighbors, because thanks to them she now has a good income and can pay for her family's basic needs. Before, the money that her husband made was not sufficient, which is why she decided to start this business. In the future, Yolanda plans to improve her establishment and have more merchandise. This will be her first loan, and she promises to make payments on time. With the 1,500 PEN, she will buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old and is married with two children between the ages 1 and 5 years old. Patrick sells body lotion, cooking oil, rice, sugar etc. His business is well organized. He starts from 7 am until 8 pm every day and has four years in this business.

Patrick has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more cooking oil, body lotion, soap, rice, sugar, Irish potaoes etc to sell. With this business, Patrick will be able to reinvest in his business and pay for his children's school fess.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, body lotion, rice, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria Bety

texts.es:
Maria Bety tiene 33 años de estado civil casado vive con su esposa y el hijo de 5 años de edad, en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, mora, fréjol.

Maria Bety  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, mora. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora, y poder terminar su casa,  para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida.  
Le gusta salir a jugar fútbol  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Bety is 33 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives with her husband and 5 year old son in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province. 

The service point Luz y Progreso (Light and Progress) is located in Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, in the Chillanes canton. This service point does agricultural work in the short planting season of corn, blackberry, and beans. 

Maria Bety does agricultural work growing corn, beans, and blackberries. She makes purchases and sales in Chillanes. 

The requested loan is for the purchase of manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for the harvest of corn, beans, and blackberries. The loan will help her to increase income for family use and to invest. Her dream is to grow more dark blackberries and to finish her house in order to have more income and a better quality of life. 

She likes to play soccer and go to the carnival.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizer for the corn, bean, and blackberry harvest.

loans.name: Parraxaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta casada, tiene 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 están estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales, específicamente de pollos de engorde, inicio este negocio cuando se caso, por la necesidad de contar con otros ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a las actividades de jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de pollos de engorde, espera en el futuro tener una granja grande de pollos de engorde. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y al comercio.
texts.en: zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzsopue8ewyryweiirwer

loans.use: to buy broilers.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités  d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des habits.
 Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur 10ème prêt solidaire. SARAN, 1ère femme debout à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces d’unit Wax, 15 Mètres de Bazin, 5 pièces de Wax Hitarget, 20 foulards et 6 pièces de Wax réal. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat  des habits

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Myrna has been in this business for 4 years now.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is the secretary of Karura Mwangaza Women Group a post she has held for the last five years. She is married with one.Susan joined with her fellow members joined WEEC in 2004 when they learnt that it trains women who would like to start there own small businesses. She got her first loan of $100 in march 2004 after attending training. The loan enabled her to start a retail shop in Ndenderu in Kiambu District. She installed a community phone in her shop, sells Celtel and Safari-com airtime cards and the business is doing very well so far.

loans.use: Susan wants to increase the stock of air time cards because the demand is ever increasing.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is married, has 3 children, , Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled  on front line in Fizuli region Makhmudlu 1 village. He has his own bee-garden.
He is well known beekeeper in his village. All people praises his honey.
In he beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought (bee)hives.
The second loan  of $700 he spent to buy  cases. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy package for packing honey.

loans.use: To buy package for packing honey

loans.name: Maliyka

texts.en: Maleyka is a Displaced Person from the occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is married, and has four children. She started her business in 1999, and borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $2300. Now she is willing to borrow $1200 to increase her variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Sefter

texts.en: S. Sefter is a local farmer from Sabirabad.  He has a big family: a wife and 3 children.  Animal husbandry is the only income source for the family besides pensions received by himself and his wife.  Sefter is 59 years old.  His business is very small, and he keeps a herd of sheep.  He has decided to improve his business by expanding into calf breeding for meat production.  To realize this idea, he has requested a loan of $1200 from Agroinvest to purchase 3 calves.

loans.use: Going to purchase 3 calves for meat production

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana C., who is 42-years of age, is married to Teodolfo Blano, 47. They have two sons who are studying in school. They acquired their own house through many years of hard work. Teodolfo works as a security guard for a company in Ybycuí, while Juliana works at home in their despensa (grocery store). She sells domestic and food products at the despensa.

The despensa began with a small amount of capital that Teodolfo was able to acquire, and they started increasing their merchandise slowly over the years. For example, they sell rice, sugar, pasta, and oil. With the despensa, Juliana is able to help support the family so that their sons can continue their studies.

They hope to get a loan in order to purchase a freezer to be able to provide the best quality of products to their clients. They plan to expand their salon and to purchase more merchandise for the despensa.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour.

loans.name: Faalaniga

texts.en:
Faalaniga is a 28-year-old lady with two kids. Her loan is for buying all the ingredients, such as bread, ham, eggs, onions and vegetables - all required for her sandwich business.

She sells the sandwiches at the nearby school, village shops and sometimes also gets orders from shops in town. This simple business helps her meet her personal and family needs as well as her kids' schooling fees. She hopes that her next loan will be used to repair her family's damaged house and towards school fees. She is very happy and appreciative to stay with SPBD’s loan program.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for her sandwich business.

loans.name: Nilda Angelica

texts.es:
Nilda belongs to the Las Riojanitas ("The Rioja Girls") community bank. The business is located in her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She earns a living selling hats and decorative objects made from "paja tratada de bomonaje" (a treated straw commonly used for making hats). Nilda is glad to be able to work with local products and to support a local craft.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,000 (2,000 Peruvian soles or about US$670), to be repaid in 6 installments, Nilda will buy 20 rolls of treated bomonaje straw, 5 rolls of cloth ribbon of different colors, and other products for making and finishing her straw hats.

Nilda, 50, is married and has 3 grown children who help her with household expenses as her husband's health is poor. She's very happy for the opportunity to work and that there's support for women to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Riojanitas, tiene ubicado su negocio en su casa ubicada en el Jr. Amargura 1132 del distrito de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de sombreros de paja tratada de bombonaje y adornos elaborados del mismo material. Ella se siente muy feliz de poder trabajar con un producto de la zona e incentivar la artesanía.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 670.00), el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará materia prima (paja de bombonaje previamente tratada) por un total de 20 rollos, cinta de tela (05 rollos de diferentes colores), 10 docenas de adornos y otros productos complementarios para la elaboración y acabado de las artesanías.

Ella está casada, tiene 50 años y tiene 03 hijos, todos mayores de edad, que le apoyan en el sustento de su hogar debido a que tiene a su esposo delicado de salud. Se siente muy feliz por el trabajo que desarrolla y así fomentar el trabajo en las mujeres.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of straw, ribbon, and cloth for hat-making business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is 49 years old. She is married to Antonio who is her same age. The couple has two children who are 20 and 16 years old. The oldest son is following the course of admission to enter a university while still studying in high school.

Carmen owns a grocery store where she began working 40 years ago and she explains that it was owned by her father until it died 10 years ago, so he left it for her to run.

Her husband is a carpenter by profession, and with the income he generates, helps with the household expenses.

The grocery store Carmen runs is well stocked and has a good clientele. Their project in the short term is to invest in building a bigger room so they can expand their grocery store.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, sweets, beverages like soda, juice, wine, cider, etc., since the Christmas and New Year holidays will bring in customers who will want to purchase these products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen tiene 49 años. Está casada con Antonio que tiene la misma edad que ella. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 20 y 16 años respectivamente. El mayor de los hijos está siguiendo el cursillo de admisión para ingresar a una carrera universitaria mientras que la menor aún continúa estudiando en la secundaria.

Carmen es propietaria de una despensa que funciona hace 40 años y según comenta ella, la misma era propiedad de su padre hasta que este falleció hace 10 años, quedándose Carmen al frente de la misma.

Su esposo es carpintero de profesión, y ayuda, con los ingresos que genera su trabajo, con los gastos del hogar.

La despensa de Carmen se encuentra muy bien surtida y cuenta con buena clientela. Su proyecto a corto plazo es invertir en la construcción de un salón más grande con el fin de surtir más su negocio.

Ahora necesita de un préstamo para la compra de harina, azúcar, panificados, bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, vinos, sidra, etc. ya que en las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo aumentan las ventas de estos productos.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, juices, wine, cider, etc. (compra de harina, azúcar, panificados, bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, vinos, sidra, etc.)

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Elisa C. , ID 077366, is single. She joined the program in January of 2007. Elisa is now in the 3 rd cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 1000MT to be reapid in 6 months. She sells beverages and soda out of her home. She plans on using this loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa C. , portadora do Pass: nº077366, solteira entrou no programa a 30/01/07 esta no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 10000 a pagar em 5 meses tem o seu negocio e sua casa vende vende bebidas e refrigerantes com o dinheiro vai aplicar no negocio.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Itit

texts.en: Itit is 38 years old and married, but her husband S. has no regular job. To meet her family's needs, she has gone into business for herself, selling rice out of her house. On a typical day, she earns $5 and a very small profit. She has applied for a loan of $100 to expand her small business. As a member of MBK, she is committed to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand a rice-selling business

loans.name: Genecith

texts.es:
Señora Genecith L. T. is an associate of the "Picota" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, Province of Picota, district of Picota. She has a wine cellar that is located in her own house in the settlement of Nueva Unión, a settlement close to Picota, where she sells groceries in general and other edible products for daily consumption. She also sells carbonated beverages.

She started her business with the first crop of corn that she produced, using the profit to invest in buying basic necessities to sell to the general public.

With the loan of 2000 soles that will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sugar in bags, sweets in packages, chicken in crates, carbonated beverages (carbonated water), rice in bags, preserved fish in boxes and other products.

She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She is known to overcome any difficulty that she is presented and this helps her to go on. She is considered a fighter, persistent and setting a great example for her children by her dedication to her business and unconditional support for her family. She wants to grow her small business by adding a greater quantity and variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Genecith L. T., es socia del Banco Comunal “ Picota” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota tiene una bodega que está ubicada en su propia casa situado en el caserío de Nueva Unión, caserío cercano a la localidad de Picota, donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario, también vende bebidas gasificadas.

Inicio su negocio con la primera cosecha del maíz que hizo producto de su cosecha, con cuya ganancia invirtió en comprar productos de primera necesidad para venderlo al público en general.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará: azúcar en sacos, dulces en paquetes, pollo en jabas y bebidas gasificadas (gaseosa), arroz en sacos, conservas de pescado en cajas y otros productos.

Ella tiene 37 años de edad, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos a sabido salir adelante de cualquier dificultad que se le presenta y eso le permite continuar. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia y quiere hacer crecer su pequeño negocio implementándolo con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, sweets, chicken, carbonated beverages (carbonated water), rice, preserved fish and other products for sale in her store.

loans.name: Sivela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Sivela K., who is married and has four children aged between 9 and 20. In 2005, Sivela established her poultry business. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks, feeders, and grain. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all that time and space will permit.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feeders, and grain.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. supplies food items to her customers in the neighboring town. She travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities, which she sells to her customers in smaller quantities. She is a single parent with 1 child. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.
